如果你想把物品/液体/气体/电能从A点运到B点而不用线缆之类的东西，全部无线传输，这就是你需要做的。把一个传送装置放在A点，另一个放在B点，给它们设置相同的频率，设置交互面，然后就可以用了。
没听懂？好吧，我们来看看这东西是怎么工作的：
公共&私人 - 切换公共/私人频率列表。这在多人游戏中更有用，用于限制其他玩家访问你的传送装置。
黑色区域 - 可用频率列表。
频率&所有者&安全 - 显示所选频率的基本信息。
设置 - 这是你创建频率的地方。给它取个名字，然后按右边的勾即可将它添加到你的频率列表中。
创建频率之后，只要确保交互面的配置可以达成你的目的即可。不同种类的资源在传送装置上有不同的交互面，请确保都设置正确了。
PS：传送装置不能运输钋或钚。
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.41.subti: 这个机器框架是RF工具箱模组机器的基础。它也用于制造一些刷怪塔实用装置。
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.42.subti: 你已经达到了另一个里程碑。这个不稳定的结构可能有助于制造强大的燃料。需要解锁第四纪元
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.43.title: 迈入21世纪
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.43.subti: 低级机器框架是你第一台机器的基础
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.44.title: 胶乳，并不是那么难制作
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.44.subti: 生产胶乳需要用树液提取器。左键点击以获取更多信息
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.44.descr: 读到这里，你即将踏入神奇的塑料世界。制造塑料需要用到一种叫做胶乳的重要物质。来了解一些有关胶乳的东西吧。
树液提取器是工业先锋模组中的机器。当树液提取器黑色面贴着原木时，它会缓慢地破坏原木，并在内罐中生成胶乳。每5个游戏刻会生成1mB胶乳，同时破坏原木的进度有0.5%的几率增加一点。
我们建议你多制造几个机器，只有一个机器会严重拖慢你的进度。请记住，树液提取器并不需要RF/FE维持运转。不过如果给它提供适量能量，它会运转得更快！
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.45.subti: 它会破坏环境！左键点击以获取更多信息
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.45.descr: 用工作台将9块小块干橡胶合成干橡胶块。
用熔炉熔化干橡胶块，就可以得到塑料。塑料是制造各种机器常用的材料，你最好把它的生产过程自动化。
完成此任务的奖励是一个配置器。这个小东西相当于一把多用途的扳手，只要它有能量，就可以用它来移除/旋转某些机器。Shift+鼠标滚轮以切换它的模式。
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.46.title: 邪恶的高级机器！
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.46.subti: 这个机器将为你打开制造高级机器的大门，它们比你现在用的这些机器先进多了！左键点击以获取更多信息
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.46.descr: 化学溶解室，用于将一种液体和至多八个物品合成为新材料。可以生产组件、升级、电路等物品。
所有的配方都是无序的，即材料可以放在任意位置上。
正在进行合成时，机器的槽位会被锁定，以防止其它物品输入。
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.47.subti: 松香用于合成信素。使用树脂提炼松香的过程中会产生副产品树油。树油可作为压缩能源炉的燃料。
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.48.subti: 流明合金是一种非常明亮的合金，它有许多用途，最重要的是用于合成信素和末影合金
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.49.title: 通往太空的信素
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.49.subti: 信素在导电性上可以说是升级版的银。在这个整合包中，它有许多用途，所以请确保你有很多这东西
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.50.subti: 再见3x3，欢迎5x5。左键点击以获取更多信息
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.50.descr: 随着你的发展，你会需要更复杂的机器。制造这些机器对于小工作台来说超纲了，你得用格子更多的工作台。于是，就有了——高级工作台！
不像普通的工作台，这东西的合成界面是5x5的。等等，别急着把你珍贵的3x3工作台扔了，因为你很快就会发现，这个5x5的好东西合成不了3x3的配方。所以啊，令人悲伤，但生活就是这样（流泪蛙蛙头.jpg。
好我们来稍微了解一下这东西是怎么工作的。你很快注意到它有一个能量缓存槽。别担心，手动合成时这个工作台并不消耗RF/FE。不过，它还可以自动合成指定的一个配方，这是需要RF/FE的。
使用这个工作台自动合成时，你首先需要指定一个配方，然后保存（Shift+右键界面右上角的按钮）。它可以储存3个配方，你可以选择其中一个进行自动合成。
保存配方后，在它的上面放一个箱子，箱子里装上所需的原料，这个工作台就会自动提取箱子中的材料自动合成了。
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.51.subti: 离IC2最近的东西。左键点击以获取更多信息
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.51.descr: 这台机器可以从某些类型的树中提取树汁或树脂。
树汁可以变成糖浆，而树脂可以变成树油。树油可作为压缩能源炉的燃料。
树汁可以从深色橡树和枫树中获得。
树脂可以从很多树中获得，但最好的是云杉树和白杨树。
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.52.title: 月球
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.52.subti: 这不就是个大奶酪轮子么？左键点击以获取更多信息
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.52.descr: 唯一能找到赛特斯石英的地方。也是主世界流星的来源。
请记住，在这里找到的戴斯矿石是建造更好的火箭的必需品。
月球上的矿物还有魔源宝石。这些亮闪闪的水晶可用于新生魔艺中，向各地传输魔源。
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.53.title: 火星
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.53.subti: 地球2.0？左键点击以获取更多信息
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.53.descr: 火星上到处都是冰。无处不在，以至于你能够在地层下找到一种独特的冰，干冰。
火星上还有一种矿物——硅。建造更好的火箭需要硅。
火星还产出一种奇怪的，亮蓝色的矿物，叫做磷灰石。之后这种矿物会有大用处。
你还能找到硝酸钾。把硝酸钾和刚才的磷灰石合成起来，你可能会得到一些有用的东西。
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.54.title: 金星和水金
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.54.subti: 金星比水星更近，但其实你先去哪个都行。左键点击以获取更多信息
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.54.descr: 为了在金星和水星的恶劣环境中生存下来，你需要一套下界合金太空服。
金星是唯一有自然生成的氟石的地方。
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.55.subti: 默认情况下可存储1MRF。如果添加了适当的升级，它最多可存储24MRF。它存取RF的速率也可以修改/升级。用作许多机器内部的能量缓冲装置。左键点击以获取更多信息
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.55.descr: 好，如果你一直都循规蹈矩地按任务来的话，这应该是你的第一个热力“机器”。所以，恭喜你！在你炸掉所有东西之前，我们来了解一下热力系列机器的界面。
在上图中你能看到一些标签，几乎所有热力系列的界面都会有那些标签。让我们挨个看看它们。
信息面板会尽量清晰简洁地描述这个机器的功能。
升级面板允许你手动给机器安装整合组件和升级组件。请记住，不同机器的升级槽的数量未必相同。升级槽数量无法以任何手段更改。
红石面板允许你设置机器是否与红石信号交互以及交互的方式。你可以选择将机器设置为忽略红石信号、接收信号时开启或接收信号时关闭。
配置面板会显示机器的所有侧面。在这里你可以设置机器是否自动输入/输出，以及在哪个面执行这个操作。为了更好地理解输入输出是怎么工作的，我们得说说颜色。蓝色是输入，橙色是输出，黄色是无互动。
最后，说说一个红石通量单元上没有的面板，能量面板。这将显示你的发电机/机器的发电量/耗电量信息。红石通量单元不生产/消耗电能，因此它没有能量面版。
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.56.title: 制作太空服
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.56.subti: 阿姆斯特朗：太空服可以让我们在大气层以外的恶劣条件下生存。 你需要用装满氧气的基础化学品储罐给胸甲充氧。
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.57.title: 火星的矿物美丽冻人
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.57.subti: 获取火星上所有种类的矿物
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.58.title: 这些矿石冒烟了耶
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.58.subti: 获取金星和水星上所有种类的矿物
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.59.title: 下界合金太空服
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.59.subti: 奥尔德林：为了在金星和水星等恶劣环境中生存，需要穿下界合金太空服。
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.61.subti: 此组件可以安装在任何热力系列的机器或工具内。它会将工具/机器的基本数据翻倍。
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.62.subti: 此组件可以安装在任何热力系列的机器或工具内。它会将工具/机器的基本数据提升到原来的四倍。
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.63.subti: 一些机器工作时需要承受高压。强化黑曜石可以确保你的机器的坚硬程度足以承受那些高压。
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.64.title: 更先进的资源运输
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.64.subti: 是的。你现在可以制造通用机械的线缆/管道了<3 左键点击以获取更多信息
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.64.descr: 完成此任务的奖励是一个配置器和一个网络读取器。
配置器可用于通用机械中的许多东西。Shift+鼠标滚轮，或按住“n”键，就可以选择配置器的模式。
网络读取器是一个用于调试通用机械网络的工具，例如通用线缆、物流管道和加压管道。它可存储24000RF，每次使用消耗1660RF。手持网络读取器右击一个网络，你就可以获得如下信息：
- 网络中空余的缓存容量
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.65.title: 让炼钢更轻松
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.65.subti: 将富集铁与10mB碳一起加工，你可以更轻松地炼出钢
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.66.title: 矿物使月球闪亮！
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.66.subti: 获取月球上所有种类的矿物
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.67.subti: 福鲁伊克斯水晶是应用能源2中的基础材料。这个模组与更好的管道模组十分相似，但在方式/模型/形式上都更优秀。将充能的赛特斯石英、下界石英和红石粉丢进水中以获取福鲁伊克斯水晶。
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.68.subti: 和福鲁伊克斯种子打个招呼吧。把它扔进水中即可种植（别担心，它不会消失）。成熟时可收获高纯福鲁伊克斯水晶，用于其它东西的合成。请确保它种在水晶生长装置里，这样你就不用等太久了。
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.69.title: 晶体催生器
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.69.subti: 让水晶长得更快！左键点击以获取更多信息
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.69.descr: 等这些该死的水晶长大大约需要20分钟。你可不能浪费这么多时间，这有让它们长得更快的方法。我们高兴地向你介绍晶体催生器。
道理很简单，你用的催生器越多，水晶长得就越快。一套装置最多能用5个催生器，每一个都会加速水晶的生长。
每个机器都需要通电（它们只能从顶面或底面接电源），这里是一套基本装置的示例：
请记住，你必须通过能源接收器为催生器提供电力，不然就不会奏效！
最后，这里是每个添加的催生器对生长速率影响的表格：
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.70.title: Making Pure Quartz Crystals
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.70.subti: Well, you can't just use regular Fluix Crystals in these machines, right? You have to use Pure ones, of course <3 Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.70.descr: The Machines you're about the make are added by Applied Energistics 2 and, in this pack, they require Pure Fluix Crystals. If you're familiar with AE2 you know that there are two ways you can get Pure Fluix Crystals.

One is to just throw them in a pond of Water, have them sorrounded by powered Crystal Growth Accelerators and wait a few minutes for them to grow. Well, this is the advanced way and you'll have access to it later, but not right now.
Ok, then what's the 2nd way? You can just throw them in a regular Water pond and wait. It takes 12 IRL hours for them to grow so make sur-

Alright, alright, there's a 3rd way. By placing one seed in a Crystal Growth Unit, you'll be able to get 8 Pure Crystals in about 20 IRL minutes. While you can get a lot of Crystals this way, it takes a lot of time to obtain them and it also requires some power. So, you'll most probably be interested in some Crystal Growth Accelerators as they're much more faster and they require less power.
Oh, also the Growth Unit cannot be upgraded.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.71.title: The Inscriber
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.71.subti: The \"I hate automation\" Machine. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.71.descr: The inscriber is used to press items using various Inscriber Plates. Each operation requires 1k RF/FE/AE charged up.
Its main use will be for crafting advanced processors which will later be used in many recipes around Ae2 and beyond.

It will be quite unfortunate to tell you that automating this machine will be quite hard. It can be fully automated using storage buses and various other means, but for now you'll be able to semi-automate it using hoppers. Use the fact that specific sides of the inscriber insert into specific slots to your advantage.
Here's how specific sides of the machine interact with its slots:
Note that the inscribers can (and should) be rotated 90 degrees with a wrench to fully take advantage of this feature.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.72.title: i3 i5 and i7
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.72.subti: These processors will be used a lot in Ae2's machines, so you better automate their production as fast as possible
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.73.subti: Because Applied Energistics 2 uses AE instead of RF! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.73.descr: Just like any other tech mod, Ae2 needs power, too. While the most majority of tech mods use RF/FE, Ae2 uses AE. Oh, wait.. you're making only RF/FE right now. Well, no problem, you can convert this type of electricity into AE with ease through the use of an Energy Acceptor.
This Transformer converts energy from external systems into AE and stores it in the ME Network. What's the ME Network? Glad you asked. That's what's comming next in the \"Storage - 3\" tab.
Oh, forgot to tell you. 2 RF/FE = 1 AE. Do what you want with this information.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.74.subti: We had no budget for Titanium :D Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.74.descr: The Black Iron is a very malleable, yet very strong alloy, capable of making various shapes and withstand large amount of stress.
You'll be able to use this material in lots of recipes, so make sure you have plenty of it in your stock.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.75.subti: Electric melting. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.75.descr: Long story short, you're here for Molten Signalum. And sorry, but no. You can't obtain it through Tinker's Construct. So, let's see how you can make it. Dear Player, meet the Magma Crucible.

The Crucible is a machine that uses power to melt items into fluids. It does this by heating up two large electum coils inside of it. When a high enough temperature is reached, the item inside will be melted. Note that each melting operation does cool down the coils, so you'll not be able to melt an entire stack of items at once. You'll have to melt each item one by one, thing which you can consider to be something good.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.76.title: The Supercritical Phase Shifter
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.76.subti: Reaching the lands of antimatter. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.76.descr: Well, well, well, look who wants to reach the realms of the Gods. Considering your very high efforts, you might actually succeed in your quest. But let's see what you have to achieve next.

Meet The Supercritical Phase Shifter. This is another multiblock structure that consumes large amount of energy and 100 mB of polonium gas to create antimatter gas, which can be crystallized into antimatter pellets. Antimatter pellets are used in a number of recipes.

The structure is expensive to build, as each SPS Casing block requires 50,000 mB of processed nuclear waste (4 polonium pellets, 1 plutonium pellet) to craft. As such, the cheapest structure will maximize the amount of reactor glass used and minimize the amount of SPS Casing used. The optimal minimal build consists of:
- 60 SPS Casings (+12 crafting material for 3 SPS Ports)
- 3 SPS Ports, one to input power, one to input Polonium and one to export Antimatter

Building this structure will be a little tricky due to the fact that is is basically, a sphere. The frame of the Supercritical Phase Shifter must consist of SPS Casings. The sides, bottom and top can consist of either SPS Casings, Reactor Glass or SPS Ports. In order to insert energy through a port a Supercharged Coil has to be attached to the SPS Port on the inside of the construct.

The structure will need 100mB of Polonium and a constant supply of 40M RF/t in order to produce 1mB/tick of Anti-matter. Note that, if less RF/tick is provided, The Supercritical Phase Shifter will simply just give you less mB/tick of Antimatter, so don't worry if you don't have the infrastructure to give this thing 40M RF/tick.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.77.title: Alloys of The End
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.77.subti: While Enderium will finally allow you to enter Mekanism and iradiate yourself in a great fashion way, the Shadow Steel will allow you to make top tier Circuits. To make ShadowSteel, just throw some Chromatic Compound into the Void in The End
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.78.title: Alien Trading 101
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.78.subti: Obtain the Inscriber Master Press from one of the Alien Villagers found in the Alien Villages present on the Moon. To get the Press, just Shift Right-Click one of the Villagers with 64 Emerald Blocks in your main hand
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.79.title: Alien Village for the Win
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.79.subti: Just like the Overworld, The Moon has Villages, too. While you can go and visit them just for a nice experience, you might quickly find out that visiting them, will get you a quite unique item. Left Click for an example of the Alien Village entrance
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.79.tasks: 到达一个月球上的外星村庄
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.80.subti: 防爆玻璃，可用于许多物品的制造。使用冶炼厂制造防爆玻璃。之后会有更容易的制造它的方法。
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.81.subti: 气体合金炉。左键点击以获取更多信息
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.81.descr: 某些气体在自然界中无法找到，或者无法从基础材料中生产，所以你得自己制造它们。对此，这个机器是个好工具。
来见见化学灌注器吧。它会通过使两种气体混合或反应来产生新的气体。JEI中的配方并没有要求把气体放在指定的罐内。例如，你把氢气放在右罐，氯气放在左罐，也可以产生氯化氢。
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.82.subti: 分类原子。左键点击以获取更多信息
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.82.descr: 制造裂变燃料只需要最后一步了。那就是同位素离心机。
这台机器将用于裂变反应堆，既可以将六氟化铀加工成裂变燃料，又可以将核废料加工成钚。
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.83.subti: This component can be installed inside of any machine or tool added by the Thermal Series. It will upgrade the base attributes of your tool/machine by a Scale Factor of 3x
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.84.subti: Bright, tough and conductive. The Refined Glowstone ingot can be used to turn RF/FE into pure light. This behaviour can be used to create a Teleporter (*yes, this is just a fancy way of saying \"you need this to craft a Teleporter\"*)
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.85.subti: The Teleportation Core will allow you to create very powerful and useful machines that can manipulate the time and space around them to teleport resources with ease
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.86.subti: The Phyto-Gro is a compound abundant in base nutrients which make it as great as Bone Meal. However, unlike Bonemeal, it can be turned into Biofuel
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.87.title: Fissile Fuel
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.87.subti: Radioactive Fuel. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.87.descr: Fissile Fuel will be burned inside of a Fission reactor. This process will produce heat and Nuclear Waste. Since you'll need A LOT of that Waste, we suggest to make a lot of this Fuel.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.88.title: Nuclear Storage 101
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.88.subti: Getting rid of radioactive material. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.88.descr: Radioactive Waste Barrels are used to store (or as buffer for) radioactive materials. They delete their contents at a rate of 1 mB per minute.

You can check the storage status of Radioactive Waste Barrels by shift right-clicking it with an empty hand. Green radiation particles start to appear as a barrel fills up (these are just a rough visual indicator of a barrel's fill ratio, not actual radiations).

Radioactive Waste barrels cannot be moved by any means (pistons, cardboard box, etc.). Also because barrels containing any radioactive waste cannot be broken safely, the only way to safely move a non empty barrel is to transfer its contents to another barrel before breaking it. This can be done by connecting a Pressurized Tube to its top or bottom side in pull mode.

Even if Radioactive Waste Barrels are somewhat blast resistant, pressurized tubes carrying waste to them are not. As a rule of thumb, do not allow creepers wandering around a fission reactor or waste transformation or disposal units.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.89.subti: Nuclear Waste is generated by burning Fissile Fuel inside in a Fission Reactor. This will be the first radioactive material you'll encounter in Mekanism and you can get rid of it through Radioactive Waste Barrels. Additionally, you can use the Waste to obtain other materials, which is, in fact, what you'll have to do to progress further
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.90.title: Uranium Hexafluoride
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.90.subti: We wouldn't touch this, but this is Minecraft, so yeah. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.90.descr: By combining Uranium Oxide with Hydrofluoric Acid in a Chemical Infuser, you can obtain the Uranium Hexafluoride which will be the base for your future fuel.
To make two buckets (2,000 mb) of Haxafluoride, you'll need 2 Uranium Ingots and 1 Fluorite Gem.
Note that finishing this quest, DOES NOT mean you did what you had to.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.91.subti: By feeding Plutonium and Fluorite Dust into a Pressurized Reaction Chamber, you can make Polonium Pallets which will be used to build The Supercritical Phase Shifter
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.92.title: Atomic Soldering
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.92.subti: Fusing some atoms together. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.92.descr: The things you'll craft in the future will literally need to have their atoms fuse together and to achieve such feats, you'll need the Crafting Core.
Each recipe made in this machine will require a certain amount of RF/FE to be provided and, also a different number of Pedestals present around the Core (more Pedestals don't hurt).

To initiate a recipe, all the items must be provided to the Core and to the nearby Pedestals. For example, to make the Shattered Singularity, one Quantum Entangled Singularity has to be placed on the Core and the other items, on the Pedestals.
If the items and power are present, the recipe will start crafting. The outputs will be dropped near the Core.
Keep in mind that each recipe will require a different amount of power. Also, some recipes will have a different power consumption rate which cannot be changed.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.93.subti: The Quantum Entangled Quarry. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.93.descr: Mining can get quite exhausting sometimes, even with a Scanner. Well, for those of you who got sick of exploring caves just to find iron and other resources, we have the Digital Miner.

This machine is used to extract ore blocks automatically. With it, you can select which ore/block you want to be extracted from the ground, the Y level at which you want it to mine, if you want to apply Silk Touch to the extracted ores/blocks, and much more.

The Digital Miner has 4 ports. The 2 green ports located on its sides will be used to power the machine. The slot present at the top will be used to pipe blocks INTO the machine. \"Wait. Into?\". Yeah, after collecting ores/blocks, the Digital Miner can replace them with other blocks of your choise. Lastly, the slot on the machine's back will be used to output the collected resources/ores.
Let's see how this machine's interface looks like:

Some of the button present here, were already covered in the quest dedicated to the Metallurgic Infuser, so check that one if you want to know what some of these buttons do, as we'll cover only the \"new\" buttons present here.
Let's start with the button located in the top left corner. That's the Visuals button which will toggle a hologram which will represent the area in which the Digital Miner will work in.

The buttons present in the blacked out area, will be used to toggle the machine's auto-eject feature (all the materials collected by the miner, will be auto-ejected to the inventory connected to port present on the Miner's back - if no inventory is available, the machine will keep all the items in its inventory), the auto-pull feature (will auto-pull items from the inventory connected to the port present on the top of the Miner), and the Silk Touch feature (will apply the Silk Touch effect on the mined blocks - this will require more RF).
The Start button will start the Miner.
The Stop button will stop the Miner from extracting ores whith its current configuration.
The Reset button will delete the current configuration applied to the Miner, allowing you to make a new one.
Finally, let's talk about the Config button. This one will open the Configuration Panel. Let's see how that one looks:
We'll cover all the elements of this panel, based on the colored sections:
Red - here you can select the area in which you want the Miner to operate in. A maximum of 32 can be selected and this area cannot be exceeded.
Yellow - Here you can select the minimum and maximum Y level at which you want the Miner to search for ores/blocks.
Orange - Here you can apply filters for the Miner to follow. Pressing \"New Filter\" will allow you to select a variety of ores/blocks based on their ItemStack/Tag/Material/ModID.

Green - Here you can select if you want the previously mentioned filter to be inverted or not. Being inverted means that the Miner will try to dig everything, but not what's on that filter. Additionally, here you can also select if the inversed mode will try to replace the mined blocks with something else, and also with what it should replace.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.94.title: Welcome to The Plastic Factory!
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.94.subti: Got the Latex? Perfect! Now to the Plastic. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.94.descr: Congrats! You maanged to obtain a great amount of Latex. Now what? Well, we're moving to the next step on the assembly line. To the Latex Processing Unit!
This amazing machine will use 100mb of Latex, 500mb of Water and a healty amount of RF/FE to produce 1 piece of Tiny Dry Rubber.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.95.subti: By dumping 25.000 items, the Matter Condenser will give you one matter ball
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.96.subti: Mekanism for the win! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.96.descr: Ok, most probably you're comming from the previous quest. If that's the case, great! If not, idk what you're doing here, but hi :)

Ok, now, getting back to the subject here. You want to teleport between multiple points from anywhere. How do you do that? Well, the Portable Teleporter has a similar interface to the one of the Teleporter. To go to a certain location, you'll just have to set the proper frequency and then just hit \"Teleport\". Yes, it's that easy.

More then that, you might be glad to hear that, with the Portable Teleporter, you'll not need a Portal Frame around your Teleporter in order to make the things work. Just place down a Teleporter, give it a frequency and you're good to go. And yeah, it doesn't even require power anymore. However, do keep in mind that the Portable Teleporter will need power.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.97.title: Mekanism's Boiler
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.97.subti: Industrial quantities of Steam. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.97.descr: If you're building this thing, you must needed a lot of steam.

The Thermoelectric Boiler is a multi-block structure used to generate steam from an external heater. Its minimum dimensions are 3x3x4 (3 long, 3 wide, 4 tall) and its maximum dimensions are 18x18x18, as with Mekanism's other multi-block structures.
The Heat can be supplied through different ways. One of them is through a Resistive Heater which will make heat by using RF/FE.
However, another way which you might find to be better, is with Superheated Sodium. This gas can be obtained from a Sodium Cooled Fission Reactor.

When cooling a Fission Reactor with Sodium, the later one will be turned into Superheated Sodium. You can use this Superheated Sodium to heat up a boiler to extreme temperatures. In result, this will produce extreme amounts of steam and will also cool down the Sodium which you can bring back to the Fission Reactor, thus creating a cooling cycle and generating power.

Ok, now let's see how to build this thing. We'll cover the process of building the smallest boiler. Note that this structure is also modular, so you can build it in any way you'd consider to be more efficient.
- Place a 3x3 base layer of Boiler Casings down.
- Place the Superheating Element in the center of the base.
- Form a heater layer by placing a 3x3 ring of Boiler Casings around the Superheating Element. You may place Structural Glass on the sides, but not the corners.

- Form a steam catch layer by placing Pressure Disperser blocks in the center and Boiler Casings or Structural Glass around the outside. The entire center of this layer must be filled with Dispersers in order for the Boiler to form.
- You may form steam cavity layers above the steam catch layer by leaving the center empty. This will increase the steam capacity of the boiler.

- Cap off the the boiler by placing a solid layer of Boiler Casings. You may use Structural Glass in the center. Red particles should emit once this layer is formed, signaling that the inside of the boiler is properly constructed.

- Finally, you'll have to add at least 2 Boiler Valves on the sides of the structure (corners will not work), so you can insert water and extract steam. 4 Valves will be required if you want to heat the Boiler with Superheated Sodium.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.98.subti: Use the Rotary Condensentrator to turn the Liquid Oxygen into Oxygen Gas! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.98.descr: Through your journey, you'll synthesize certain substances in the form of a liquid and you might find yourself in a situation where you'll need the gas version of that liquid. Things can also be the other way around, but that doesn't matter. Now, what do you do?
Easy. You obtain the Rotary Condensentrator. This machine's purpose is to process various liquids into gasses, and vice versa. Later, this machine will be a part of the Lithium production process.

The Rotary Condensentrator has two operating modes: Condensentrating, and Decondensentrating. The former turns gasses into liquids, and the latter does the opposite. One side of the machine always accepts fluids, and the other side, gasses.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.99.subti: Lithium dust can be considered the heart and soul of a true battery. Use this fine dust to make the elements required for an Induction Matrix, which essencially, is a very large, modular battery
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.100.subt: Brine and Lithium. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.100.desc: If you're reading this, it means that you're here either for Lithium, or Sodium. Or both actually. Let's go and find out what The Thermal Evaporation Plant is and what you can do with it.
This is a multiblock structure added by Mekanism. It is used for the production of Brine which can be turned either into Sodium or Lithium.
Sodium can be used as a Coolent in a Fission Reactor.
Lithium can be turned into Lithium Dust which can further be used to build very large batteries.

Now let's see how you can build this structure. The Thermal Evaporation Plant is a 4x4 structure which has a minimum height of 3 blocks. This can be extended to 18 blocks for a larger internal tank. Here's how the smallest structure looks like:

One of the sides has to include the Thermal Evaporation Controller. The rest of the structure has to be made out of Thermal Evaporation Blocks. You can add Valves depending on your needs. These Valves are used to input/output liquids in/from the strucuture and you can have as many as you want, as long as they're on the sides of the structure, and not on its edges.

Ok, now how do you use this thing? Water has to be pumped into the Evaporation Plant through one of its Valves. After that, heat has to be provided to the structure through one of its vents, or through direct contact with one of its sides. \"Wait... heat?\" Yeah.

Mekanism has a temperature system. Certain multiblocks/machines will produce a certain amount of heat. This heat can be transfered around with some Thermodynamic Conductors. Think of this heat as of RF/FE. You can generate it with a Resistive Heater (uses RF/FE to produce heat). Heat is, then, used to power the Evaporation Plant. Heat can also be transfered from other sources, but we're keeping this explaination as simple as possible. You can always do your own research on Mekanism's heat system, if you want to find more information about it.
Ps: The biome you're in, also affects the temperatures added by Mekanism.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.101.titl: He's so ugly! I love him!!! <3
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.101.subt: A Robit will be your best friend, we promise. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.101.desc: Do you feel like your dog needs a friend? You have too much power? Too much free time? Then the Robit is for you.
Robit is Mekanism's mechanical companion. He can act as a crafting grid, a furnace, an anvil, a chest, or simply a cute little buddy.

Once you've obtained your Robit, you'll have to right click a Chargepad with him in hand. This will spawn Robit and assign that pad as his home point. After power is provided to Robit through the Chargepad, he'll be able to follow you.

Now, a bit off topic, but let's talk about the Chargepad (which is the reward for finishing this quest). When it is given power, it will recharge all the items from your inventory that support it. Power can be provided to the Pad through its back, or from underneath.
Now, back to our star, the Robit. Once you've placed him down, right click on him. This will bring up he's interface. Let's see how that looks:
Red - Home button. Will teleport Robit back to he's home.
Yellow - Name button. Will allow you to change your Robit's name.
Greed - Appearance button. Will allow you to change your Robit's appearance. Spoiler: LGBTQ+ Community memebers will love this <3
White - Information Screen. Will show basic info about your Robit.
Aqua - Charging Slot. Here you can place charged capacitors/energy cubes in order to keep your Robit charged up.
Blue - Pickup Mode button. Will allow you to turn on/off Robit's item pickup feature. While he's following you, Robit will try to pickup all the nearby items, and store them in he's inventory.
Orange - Follow button. Will allow you to control if your Robit is following you, or not.
Pink - Utility buttons. These buttons will allow you to access Robit's utility features. These include a Crafting Grid, a Chest, a Furnace and an Anvil.
Purple - Security button. This one will allow you to control which category of players are allowed to access your Robit.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.102.subt: Chernobyl Worker: Offers protection against radiation. This can be later integrated into The Meka Suit
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.103.subt: The Rover can be used as a transport method on other planets
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.104.subt: Oxygen not included! Actually yeah, cuz it's liquid. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.104.desc: Due to your current technological advancement - which is not that great, duh - you're not capable of using a clean and classic elecrolysis process, so you'll have to cheat the physics a bit.

By combining an electrolytic core with the capabilities of an amazing Fridge and an Ice Unit, you can make a Cryo-Electrolyzer. This machine will use Water and Blizz Powder to create Liquid Oxigen. You should be able to turn it into regular Oxygen quite easily with another machine.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.105.subt: This Altar will allow you to automate all the recipes present in Astral Sorcery, and beyond, by using the ME system. Unfortunately, you won't be able to automate recipes that have ingredients with special NBT data. This is a limitation of the ME System itself
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.title: Gear - 4
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.0.subtit: The Uraninite is incredibly dense in energy, and has value both in crafting and as a fuel source for a specialized reactor. You will need a good amount of this, so make sure you are able to grow lots of it. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.0.descri: Unlike a regular Powah experience, here, things will be a little different.

While you can normaly find Uraninite Ore in the world, in this pack, the only way to obtain it is by growing it with Uraninite Seeds. Until you're able to start Mystical Agriculture and obtain precious resources from seeds, you'll have to keep working on the tech side and obtain power from other sources
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.1.subtit: The Dielectric Paste has the ability to conduct electricity better than anything else, thus making it perfect for high-end electronics
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.2.title: The Prime Ingot
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.2.subtit: The Prime Ingot is an incredibly expensive alloy used for crafting items normally exclusive to Creative Mode. Required to unlock The EndGame
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.3.title: Nitro Reactor
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.3.subtit: The Nitro Reactor will produce around 170kRF/t. When Redstone, Carbon and a Coolant are provided, it will output around 400kRF/t
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.4.title: Energizing Setup Starter
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.4.subtit: A bit of Power, a bit of crafting, a bit of everything. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.4.descri: Just like the other big mods out there, Powah has its own Crafting system. Say 'hello' to the Energizing Process, where you'll take lots of Items, lots of Power, you're gonna combine them together, and hope for the best.
The main component of the Energizing Process will be the Energizing Orb, which is a tiny chamber were item can be inserted either by Right-Clicking, or by other means, such as transport pipes.

The other component of the setup, will be the Energizing Rods. These will add power to the Energizing Orb once a valid recipe is detected. Note that you can use more of them, and having higher tiers, will speed up the crafting process substancially.
The Starting Tier of the Energizing Rod will provide 10kRF/t I/O speeds.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.5.title: Energizing Setup Hardened
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.5.subtit: The Hardened Tier of the Energizing Rod will provide an energy transfer rate of 120kRF/t
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.6.title: Energizing Setup Blazing
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.6.subtit: The Blazing Tier of the Energizing Rod will provide an energy transfer rate of 300kRF/t
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.7.title: Energizing Setup Niotic
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.7.subtit: The Niotic Tier of the Energizing Rod will provide an energy transfer rate of 700kRF/t
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.8.title: Energizing Setup Spirited
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.8.subtit: The Spirited Tier of the Energizing Rod will provide an energy transfer rate of 1.2MRF/t
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.9.title: Energizing Setup Nitro
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.9.subtit: The Nitro Tier of the Energizing Rod will provide an energy transfer rate of 3MRF/t
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.10.title: Hardened Reactor
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.10.subti: The Hardened Reactor will produce around 30kRF/t. When it's provided with Redstone, Carbon and a Coolant, it will provide around 50kRF/t
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.11.title: Blazing Reactor
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.11.subti: The Blazing Reactor will produce around 40kRF/t. When Redstone, Carbon and a Coolant are provided, it will output around 80kRF/t
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.12.title: Niotic Reactor
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.12.subti: The Niotic Reactor will produce around 100kRF/t. When Redstone, Carbon and a Coolant are provided, it will output around 200kRF/t
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.13.title: Spirited Reactor
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.13.subti: The Spirited Reactor will produce around 130kRF/t. When Redstone, Carbon and a Coolant are provided, it will output around 300kRF/t
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.14.subti: The Base for most of the machines added by Powah. You should obtain lots of these, as they'll be used quite a lot in the future
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.15.subti: Fuel and also, material. This ingot stores large amounts of power and potential. To obtain it, you'll need a Dragon Heart and large amounts of power. It will be used as fuel in the Draconic Reactor, which is a very powerful generator
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.16.subti: Welcome to the Draconic Fusion Crafting. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.16.descr: Fusion Crafting is a ritual-like method of crafting added by Draconic Evolution and is used to create higher tier materials and tools/armor at the expense of large amounts of power.

At the center of the crafting setup is the Fusion Crafting Core. Arranged around the outside, pointing towards the core, are a number of Fusion Crafting Injectors. Crafting ingredients are placed in the Injectors with a Right-Click, and a focus item is placed in the Core via the GUI.

The crafting process needs to be started from the Core's GUI. A redstone signal can also be used to start the process without manual intervention. When crafting commences, the Injectors begin to draw RF power. Sparks appear around the Fusion Crafting Injectors and bubbles of energy around the held items. When sufficient RF power has been absorbed, the bubbles of energy swarm around the Fusion Crafting Core. When the crafting is complete, the item can be removed from the core. The Fusion Crafting Core retains information when harvested, thus if the process is disturbed prior to completion, neither the ingredients nor energy are lost.
Example of a Fusion Crafting setup:
A maximum amount of 10 Injectors have to be provided. Each Injector needs access to power. Each recipe will require a different Tier of Injector. There are 4 Tiers:

Some recipes will require higher Tier Injectors. You'll have to upgrade all of your Injectors depending on the recipe you want to make. Note that higher Tiers can execute recipes which require a lower Tier.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.17.subti: The Draconium Ingot is and Energized Steel based alloy and it is the main ingredient in most of the recipes added by Draconic Evolution - an Endgame mod focused around overpowered items and content. Try to obtain lots of it, as you'll need it in the future
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.18.subti: Just like Powah and Mystical Agriculture, Draconic Evolution also has Tiered items. There are 4 Tiers which are mainly based on Cores such as these. The Draconium Core is related to the 1st Tier and it will allow you to access some of Draconic Evolution's basic machines
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.19.subti: The Wyvern Core is essentially the base for Draconic Evolution's 2nd Tier. It is made with Niotic Crystals and it has a Nether Star as base
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.20.subti: Say 'Hi!' to Draconic Evolution's 3rd Tier which uses the Draconic Core as a base. It is also made with Nitro Crystals and it has a Nether Star as base
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.21.subti: The Chaotic Core is the base for Draconic Evolution's 4nd Tier. It is made with Dark Matter. Same as before, it has a Nethar Star as base
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.22.subti: Draconic Fusion Injector Tier 1 - Now made with Radiant Casings
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.23.subti: Draconic Fusion Injector Tier 2 - Now made with Draconium Ingots
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.24.subti: Draconic Fusion Injector Tier 3 - Now made with Awakened Draconium Ingots
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.25.subti: Draconic Fusion Injector Tier 4 - Now made with Chaos Shards
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.26.subti: The Chaotic Shards are a dark, unstable and very powerful item which can be found in Chaos Islands in The End. These can be harvested after defeating The Chaos Guardian
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.27.subti: Welcome to 7x7 Crafting where the Elite Auto Crafting Table will be your best friend. This machine can assemble all of the recipes which were previosly made in the Advanced Auto Crafting Table, and of course, it also allow for the crafting of new, bigger recipes
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.28.subti: The Aeternium Ingot will allow you to enter Industrial Foregoing and basically automate with ease most of the processes you can think of
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.29.subti: The Terminite Ingot is an alloy which is mainly used in the production of Overcharged Casings and Aeternium Ingots
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.30.title: Reaching the year 2099
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.30.subti: Combine some Flux-Infused Dust with some Obsidian Dust to obtain the Dielectric Compound
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.31.title: Energizing Setup Basic
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.31.subti: The Basic Tier of the Energizing Rod will provide an energy transfer rate of 50kRF/t
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.32.title: Starter Reactor
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.32.subti: Powah Forever! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.32.descr: Let's cover the Powah Reactor, since you'll need lots of RF and and a fast and efficient way of obtaining it.
Powah has 7 Multiblock Reactors with different tiers which are directly impacting their performance/stats.
This is the Starter Reactor which requires 36 Reactor blocks to be built. This amount of block will stay the same which each Reactor.

Now, about building this thing. Unlike other mods, Powah will assist you in building the reactor. If you're holding 36 Reactor blocks in your hand, when right-clicking a block with them, the Reactor Multiblock will attempt to build itself. It that's not possible due to several reasons, you'll be notified.
Ok, you've learned how to build it. Now, how do you use it?
When the middle slot of the Reactor is supplied with Uraninite, power will be produced.

At the same time, heat will be produced. High temperatures will cause the Reactor to consume more and more fuel and produce less RF/tick. It can be cooled down with Liquids, such as Water, of Liquid Hydrogen. Additionally, Solid Coolants, such as Show, Ice, or Dry Ice can be used to cool down the Reactor even more. However, Solid Coolants will require a Liquid Coolant to work.
All Reactos can receive additional 'augments' in the form of Carbon and Redstone.
When Carbon is provided, an additional 180+ degrees will be added, but you'll also get better fuel efficiency. This essentialy means that you'll get more amounts of RF from one Uraninite piece.
Now, Redstone is used to speed up the production rate of the RF and the consumption rate of the Fuel. Also, 120+ degrees will be added.

The Reactor also has an Auto Mode which can be turned on, or off from its GUI. If it is turned on, the Reactor will stop when its internal energy buffer is filled, and will restart only if the buffer is bellow 70%. This might be very useful if you're interested in saving as much Fuel as possible.
Lastly, the Reactor can be controlled using Redstone. Also, from its GUI you can configure how each face of the Reactor works/outputs power.
The Started Reactor will produce around 4kRF/t. If Redstone, Carbon and a potent Coolant are provided, around 7kRF/t will be produced.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.33.title: Basic Reactor
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.33.subti: The Basic Reactor will produce around 14kRF/t. If Redstone, Carbon and a potent Coolant are provided, it will produce around 28kRF/t
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.34.subti: The base for most of the machines added by Industrial Foregoing
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.35.subti: Will allow you to access more machines added by Industrial Foregoing. It will also unlock Draconic Evolution's Fusion Crafting
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.36.subti: Used in high-tier machines added by Industrial Foregoing. This includes, and it's not limited to the Infinity Charger, the Mechanical Dirt, and more. You'll also be able to build Nether Stars easier with it
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.37.title: Starter Tier
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.37.subti: The Powah mod has tier based machines which are used to manipulate and create electricity. This will be the first tier and it will be made using Tin as a base
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.38.title: Basic Tier
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.38.subti: The 2nd Machine Tier added by Powah. Made using Energized Iron as a base
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.39.title: Hardened Tier
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.39.subti: The 3rd Machine Tier added by Powah. Made using Energized Steel as a base. This Tier will also allow you to obtain Draconium Ingots and start working on Industrial Foregoing, and eventually, Draconic Evolution
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.40.title: Blazing Tier
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.40.subti: The 4th Machine Tier added by Powah. It uses Blazing Crystals as a base
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.41.title: Niotic Tier
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.41.subti: The 5th Machine Tier added by Powah. It uses Niotic Crystals as a base
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.42.title: Spirited Tier
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.42.subti: The 6th Machine Tier added by Powah. It uses Spirited Crystals as a base
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.43.title: Nitro Tier
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.43.subti: The 7th, and last, Machine Tier added by Powah. It uses Nitro Crystals as a base
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.44.subti: The Dielectric Block has two properties. It is very conductive and it is so strong that it can serve as a great structural support for a lot of machines
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.45.subti: Advancing with mob farms. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.45.descr: The Mob Slaughter Factory is a machine very similar to a Mob Grinder. However, it is a little more advanced, meaning that it is NOT used to produce XP out of mobs. Its main outputs will be Liquid Meat and Liquid Pink Slime.
The default working area is 1x3x1 in front of the machine and can be expanded with Range Addons.

Mobs killed will produce 5 mb of Liquid meat per HP and 1 mb of Pink Slime per HP. The Mob Slaughter Factory deals 300 damage per operation, killing all Vanilla mobs other than the Wither in a single hit. Fluid can be collected from the internal tanks by Right-Clicking with an empty Bucket, or by using liquid pipes.
Example of the Mob Slaughter Factory GUI:

Orange - The Progress Bar whereyou'll be able to see the current working process of the Machine, the power consumption and the Estimated Time of Arrival, which is the time remaining until a process is finished.
BROWN - That's the Liquid Meat tank. By clicking on the Brown Square present bellow, you can select the side configuration of the machine, for Liquid Meat (the RED area).
PINK - The Liquid Pink Slime tank and the side configuration for Liquid Pink Slime

YELLOW - That's the Working Area button. After clicking on it, a hitbox will appear outside of the machine, showing where the Mob Slaughter Factory will have effects. This area can be further increased with Range Addons.
GREEN - Addons panel. Here you can place Addons to improve the machine's overall performance, increase the working area and more.
LIGHT BLUE - Here you'll be able to manually extract liquids from the machine.

Lastly, know that, if the Meat Tank of the Factory is filled up, all the additional kills executed by the machine, will result in loss of Meat. Same thing will happen to the Pink Slime Tank, so make sure you have either lots of Tanks available for storage, or a system which will stop the mob from spawning when a Tank is full, or both!
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.46.title: Pink Slime Byproducts
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.46.subti: The Slimeball and the Ingot will be required to advance further. While you can just infuse some Aluminum with Liquid Pink Slime to obtain the Ingot, the Slimeball will be more difficult to obtain. Pink Slimeballs have to be grown using seeds from Mystical Agriculture
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.47.subti: The Overcharged Casing will act like binding element in all the machines/devices that will require it
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.48.title: Advanced Universal Wireless Transport
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.48.subti: The Ender Core will enable some unique Wireless Charging capabilities. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.48.descr: This Core can be used in a numerous number of recipes, but its main use will be to upgrade certain Powah machines with some unique wireless abilities.
Energy Cells can be turned into Ender Cells, which will give you access to the Ender Network. It will be similar to the Quantum Entangloporter, but it will transport RF only.
Cables can be turned into Gates, which will act like wireless access points to the Ender Network.
Binding Cards can be turned into Dimensional Binding Cards which will allow a Player Transmitter to provide power to your inventory regardless of the Dimension you're in.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.49.title: Wireless Dimensional Charging
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.49.subti: These two components will allow you to start using some very powerful charging features. While the Player Aerial Pearl will allow you to build a Player Transmitter, the Binding Card will allow you to receive Power from the Transmitter on an infinite range while you're in the same dimension as the Transmitter. Look in the 'Useful Items - 4' tab for more info about the Player Transmitter
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.50.title: Molecular Exchanger
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.50.subti: Early item exchanging can be obtained through the use of this machine. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.50.descr: The Antiprotonic Nucleosynthesizer is a machine added by Mekanism. Its main use is to take items, small amounts of Antimatter and fair amounts of power to obtain new items.
With it, you can obtain Diamonds from Coal, Iron Ingots from Tin, and more. Use JEI to see what other transmutations you can perform with it.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.51.title: The Quantum Compressor
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.51.subti: The Key to Relativity. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.51.descr: The Quantum Compressor is a high-tech press added by Extended Crafting. It takes a Catalyst (which is NOT consumed when crafting) a certain material and large amounts of RF, to craft very expensive items.
Its main use if for making Singularities.

Its material slot can be locked to limit the access to its internal inventory. If, at any point, you want to retrive your items from the Compressor, just press the \"Eject\" button located above the material slot.

Lastly, each recipe will require a certain amount of power. The recipe will be finished only after all the required power is provided to the Compressor. Each recipe has a different energy consumption rate, which CANNOT be modified, so if you're making a recipe which requires 100000000000 RF, but it's consumption rate is 10 RF/t, there's nothing you can do to speed up the crafting process.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.52.title: Starter Solar Panel
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.52.subti: Obtaining the Powah of the Sun. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.52.descr: Solar Panels are an amazing milestone. These machines will allow you to produce power as long as they're placed in Overworld, it is day time and they're not obstructed by anything.

Note that, they're role will be mainly on the support side, as they can't really produce lots of power by themselves, but they can come in handy in large Power Networks, where just a tiny bit of additional power will be required to keep everything running.
The Starter Solar Panel will produce a puny amount of 25RF/t.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.53.title: Basic Solar Panel
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.53.subti: The Basic Solar Panel will produce a total amount of 50RF/t
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.54.title: Hardened Solar Panel
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.54.subti: The Hardened Solar Panel will produce 110RF/t
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.55.title: Blazing Solar Panel
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.55.subti: The Blazing Soalr Panel will produce 220RF/t
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.56.title: Niotic Solar Panel
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.56.subti: The Niotic Solar Panel will output a total amount of 500RF/t
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.57.title: Spirited Solar Panel
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.57.subti: The Spirited Solar Panel will output 1000RF/t
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.58.title: Nitro Solar Panel
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.58.subti: The Nitro Solar Panel will provide 1500RF/t
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.59.subti: Iridium is an alloy mainly used for making the casings required for Mekanism's QIO computers. The QIO system is a storage option similar to AE2's ME system. It is easier to use, but it it's also less versatile
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.60.title: Not Enough Singularities
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.60.subti: Singularities are very expensive and dense items. They're made from Nether Star Blocks as a base, a material, and lots of RF. There are 18 Singularities and you'll have to make all of them. Each Singularity will require 10048 pieces of a material. This is equal to 157 stacks of that material. Good luck obtaining all of them ☺
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.61.title: The Ultimate Singularity
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.61.subti: By combining all the other 18 Singularities, you can obtain the Ultimate Singularity, which can be used to obtain Dark and Red Matter
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.62.subti: The Neutronium Ingot is a very dense material which will serve as a base for the strongest Alloy known to mankind. Make sure you obtain planty of these. You'll need them
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.63.subti: The Neutron Collector will be the worst way of obtaining Neutronium Ingots. Unlike its upgraded versions, or as we like to call them - Older Brothers - the Neutron Collector is able to make only small Piles of Neutronium Dust. 9 of these Piles can be turned into Nuggets, which can later be turned into Ingots. Using 8 Nuggets, Ingots and then, Blocks, you can obtain the upgraded versions of this machine. They'll be able to produce larger amounts of Neutronium in the same amount of time as before. These machines will not require any power
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_4.quests.64.subti: Even Thanos would kneel before this thing: The Infinity Ingot will be used to upgrade some of your tools and armor to the next level, thus obtaining the ultimate instruments. It is also used in some creative items recipes
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.title: Introduction
We highly recommend reading this. Left Click for more info

The Quests we've designed here, are meant to guide you through your journey. Keep in mind that we assume you're already accustomed with the most majority of the mods included in the game, so do not expect any beginner level type of tutorials :')

This quests menu can be accessed either through your inventory, or by pressing 'BACKSPACE' on your keyboard, so you don't have to craft or use any book which would take away from your inventory space. Spoiler: In the beginning, you'll need as much space as possible.
It is HIGHLY recommended that you follow the quest lines as they'll explain how to do certain things.
-The main progression of the pack, is represented by the Square Shape.
-There will be certain quests which you may consider to be your main goal, these quests are listed under the Diamond Shape.
-The quests under the Circle Shape represent common/regular/usual tasks.
- The quests under the Gear Shape represent extremely useful items, items that you should take interest into.
- Lastly, the quests under the Heart shape represent legendary items/tasks.

Finally, we want to let you know how FTB quests works. Almost every quest has, or SHOULD have a dependency. This dependecy can be in the same tab as the quest you want to finish, or can be in another tab.
If the dependency is in the same tab, some line will be drawn between the dependecy and its quest.
However, if the dependency is in another tab, no visual representation will be given.
To see all the dependencies of a quest, you'll have to click on the top left arrow in the quest's description:
Another example would be this quest's dependency, which is \"The Decursio Project\" quest.

Most of the time, you won't be able to start a quest until all of its dependencies are finished. However, there will be a numerous number of occasions where this will NOT be the case, and you'll be able to start a quest without finishing all of its dependencies.
Sick of hicking? Jump into other worlds, duh! Left Click for more info
The Dimensional Explorer group will guide you through the steps you need to do in order to get to all the dimensions provided in the pack.
Note that the dimensions are locked under game stages, so a simple task like getting to The Nether will be much harder here.
Just follow the quest lines and you should be ok. If you want to get into a certain dimension, just go to its tab in the \"Dimensional Explorer\" group, and see what requirements that dimension has.

Oh, things you should know: AE2, Ars Nouveau and Draconic Evolution are installed, BUT certus quartz, source gems and draconium ore are available only on The Moon, Venus and Mercury. So yeah, good luck getting there.
Lastly, here's an example of how you unlock and finish The Nether:
Welcome - Make sure to check our Wiki for the latest info available; you can find it on our Curseforge page. Left Click for more info
Hi! If you're reading this it means that you've agreed to the terms and conditions of our contract and you are ready to begin an amazing Journey.
This modpack was designed to challenge the skills, patience and the modded Minecraft knowledge of every individual.
To make you more comfortable with the challenges you're about to experiance, I'd say we should tell you what are some of this pack's features:
- Expert style progression system based around quests
- Realistic mechanics, such as temperature, seasons and nutrition

If you haven't read our terms and conditions, you should know that this is your LAST CHANCE of aborting this Journey. If you don't want to continue, please close the game now. If you want to continue, just keep reading.
Great! You've decided to stay. We appreciate your thirst and desire for a great challenge! And now that you are ready to begin..
We, here, at Decursio Entertainment Inc. are pleased to present to you..
Main questline focused on Tech. Left Click for more info
The 'Gear' quest tabs will be your MAIN progress line, right next to the 'Arcane' tabs. These ones will guide you through most of the 'realistic'/NOT related to magic things.
Main questline focused on Magic. Left Click for more info
The 'Arcane' quest tabs will be your MAIN progress line, right next to the 'Gear' tabs. Similar to the 'Gear' tabs, the 'Arcane' tabs will mainly be about the magic/alchemy-related tasks.
The 'Tools' tabs will try to show you all the possible tools you are able to make in your current Age.
Yes, part of this is the ME system
The 'Storage' tabs will try to guide you through all the possible storage options you have available in the respective Age.
What do you expect? Oh, The Armours You'll Go
This series of tabs, will be focused in showing you all the armor possibilities available in your current Age.
Focused on useful/interesting items, this series of tabs will show you a bunch of Appealing Apparatus available in your current Age.
Feeling like in Ratatouille! Left Click for more info
The 'Cookbook 365th Edition' tab, unlike other tabs, is universal, meaning that all the food-related stuff will be here from the begining of the pack, 'till the end of it.
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quests.10: Useful anytime. Left Click for more info
Like the 'Cooking!' tab, this one is universal too.
The 'Relics/Artifacts' tab is gonna keep track of all the rare, bonuses giving items that you find around the multiverse.
The Artifacts and the Relics mods are installed. They're gonna provide items which you can find in dungeons. When equipped, these items give unique bonuses.
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quests.11: Want to complete the quests with your friends? Make a team. Left Click for more info
To make a team use '/ftbteams party create'.
To invite a player to your party use '/ftbteams party invite ~player_name~'.
To accept an invite, you can click the invitation received in chat.
You can leave a party by using '/ftbteams party leave ~party_name~'.
Note that IF YOU LEAVE A TEAM with completed quests, you'll loose all the progress you've made. Also, if the party is dissolved, the progress will, again, be lost.
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quests.12: The 'Music!' tab will guide you through the process of making music, or as Miles would call them, 'beats'!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quests.13: Friends for life. Left Click for more info
The 'Doggy Talents' tab will keep track of most of the things added by Doggy Talents 2!
To summarize, Doggy Talents 2 upgrades the vanilla dogs, thus making them much more smarter, stronger and useful.
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quests.14: SimsCraft? Left Click for more info
This tab will keep track of the things you'll be doing in the MineColonies mod.
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quests.15: The Hats mod is installed. By pressing 'H' you can open the hats menu and equip any hat you like <3 Keep in mind that, in survival, you'll have to kill certain mobs, to obtain their hats
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quests.16: You're on a server, right? Left Click for more info
This pack includes two features which will make your interactions with other players more fun.
With PlayerRevive you can help other players in certain battles. After a player dies, he/she/they can be revived within a 60 seconds period after their death.
With the mailing system provided by Mr. Crayfish's Furniture mod, you can send certain packages to players across the map. More info can be found in 'Useful Items - 1'.
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quests.17: WE HIGHLY RECOMMEND YOU TO READ THIS! Left Click for more info

This pack uses the Totally Harmonious Item Stages mod to force the player to go through a certain Age before going to the next one. Different items are locked to different Ages. These items will appear as 'Unknown Item'. You won't be able to use these 'Unknown Items'. Things such as Tools cannot be used. Armor cannot be worn. Blocks cannot be placed. Blocks such as furnaces cannot be placed and if you manage to find one that's already placed, you won't be able to access it.

If you attempt to open a Crafting Interface to craft certain items, all of the 'Unknown Items' will be dropped out of your inventory and you won't be able to pick them up as long as you have that Crafting Interface opened (&cBE AWEAR! THIS INCLUDES FURNACES, ANVILS AND OTHER STATIONS - JUST THE STORAGE CONTAINERS WILL BE AVAILABLE FOR THESE ITEMS - THESE INCLUDE CHESTS, BACKPACKS, CRATES, BARRELS&r).

Also, some items will have certain types of interactions available (for example, you can open Chests, but you cannot place them until you actually unlock them). To find out how you can interact with something, just look as the item's tooltip. Oh, don't worry, you CAN place the 'Unknown Items' in chests and other storage blocks.
Apart from items, Ages are also gating the following contents:
1. Amount of available chunks for force loading
2. Overall mobs difficulty on the map

1. Unlike other packs, chunk loading will be a bit of a problem here. With each Age you unlock, more chunks will be available for force loading. Here's how many chunks you'll have available for force loading in each Age:

2. With each Age, mobs will get stronger, similar to SevTech Ages. They'll be able to use armor and items such as Ender Pearls to get a hold of you. We'd suggest to prepare yourself with stronger gear before claiming an Age, as you might bet overwhelmed by them. Here's the difficulty of each Age:

3. To stop you, the player, from using certain vanilla methods to advance through this pack faster, certain features have been gated to the 2nd Age. These features are the ability to build Iron Golems and the ability to light a Nether Portal with fire. Starting with the pack's 2nd Age, these features will become available.
\"Amm.. guys, I need to get in the Nether in the 1st Age, you know that, right?\"
Don't worry about it. You'll find a way to light up the portal when the time comes.
4. Astral Sorcery's leveling system is capped to 40 Levels. However, they'll be limited per Age. You'll unlock the system in the 2nd Age. Here's how the levels are capped through the pack:
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quests.18: How to chunk load? Left Click for more info
In this pack, chunk loading is provided by a combination of FTB Chunks and Journey Map.
Let's see how to actually force load a chunk if you're not familiar.
Open the Journey Map menu by pressing \"M\". The world map will be visible and, on the mid-right side of the screen, the FTBChunk Claiming Mode button will be available.

After turning the Chunk Claiming mode on, you'll be able to Claim an area of chunks to prevent other players from interacting with them. Additionally if you press shift click on your claimed chunks, you'll force load them. Note that you have a limited amount of chunks to claim and a limited amount of chunks to force load. You can see how many available you currently have in the buttom left corner.
Chunks can also be claimed from your inventory. Just press on the Map icon present in the top left corner.

Important: After unlocking a new Age you'll need to Click through the chunk claiming GUI to update your currently available chunks for force loading. It's just a minor visual update issue, nothing to worry about.
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quests.19: It will eventually happen. Left Click for more info
Ok, face it. You're not Superman or anything, so you'll have to deal with death at point. Or.. you might actually be Superman given the fact that you respawn after you die.. :/
Anyway, what happens after you die? It's modded Minecraft, so something special must happen, right? Right??? Well, of course, duhh.

This pack uses the Corpse mod to assist you with your deaths. After you die, a Corpse which has all of your items will spawn at your death location, so you can collect the items with ease. This Corpse will not fall into the void and will not be damaged by lava, so your precious items should be safe. However, if something unexpected happens, you should be able to get your items back using creative mode and this command: /deathhistory <your_name>
This will open your death history menu where you can click the 'Items' button to access your last corpse. While you're in creative mode you can retrive them.

Now let's talk about some of the corpse mechanics. When it first appears, it will look exactly like you (cuz..yeah, it is you). Only you'll be able to access it at this point. However, after 6 minutes, the corpse will turn into a Skeleton. In this state, any player will be able to access the corpse, so if you're on a server, make sure to get your items back as quickly as possible.
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quests.20: Somehow simple mob/resource farms. Left Click for more info

This tab will be focused on guiding you through the Resourceful Bees mod. While more information will be given there, just know that you'll be able to get items such as Rotten Flesh, Bones, Gunpowder from Bees.
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quests.21: Got an issue? These might help. Left Click for more info
Issues can occur in every pack. This one is NOT an exception. If for some reason you get into problems with the Ages, here's a list of commands that should assist you through your journey:
- \"&a/thitemstages add <your_name> <the_gamestage_you_need>&r\": This command will give you the Age of you choise.
- \"&a/thitemstages remove <your_name> <the_age_you_don't_want_anymore>&r\": This command will remove from you the Age you want.
- \"&a/thitemstages all&r\": Will give you all the knwon Ages.
- \"&a/thitemstages clear&r\": Will remove all the Ages you currently have.

- \"&a/ftbranks add <your_name> age_1&r\": Will give you the chunk loading abilities of the 1st Age. Change \"&aage_1&r\" with \"&aage_2&r\", \"&aage_3&r\", \"&aage_4&r\" to obtain the loading abilities of the Age of your choise.

- \"&a/ftbranks remove <your_name> age_1&r\": Will remove the chunk loading abilities of the 1st Age from your. \"&aage_1&r\" can be changed with \"&aage_2&r\", \"&aage_3&r\", \"&aage_4&r\" to remove the loading abilities of different Ages from you.
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quests.22: There are 7 main Boss Fight in this pack. Left Click for more info
This pack also aims to challange you through various Boss Fights. We've prepared 7 of them just for you. Let's see what your worst enemies will be and how they're distributed through the pack:
Now, let's talk a bit about the first 5 Boss Fights. These will be quite special due to the fact that they'll be required in order to get to The End. Why? It's quite simple.

This pack uses the End Remastered mod to change the way in which you're getting to The End. Instead of 12 Eyes of Ender, you'll need 12 unique Eyes. Now, upon defeating the first 5 Bosses mentioned previously, you'll be rewarded with a number of those 12 Eyes. When you have all of them, you'll be able to go to The End.

Take good care of these Eyes after you obtain them, because if you somehow manage to lose one of them, well.. there's no way to get it back besides creative commands. And yeah, you need all of them to open The End Portal.

Oh, yeah. Also know that these Eyes can be used to find the Stronghold just like some regular Eyes of Ender would be used. They do not break in the air like the Ender Eyes do, so do not be afraid to use them as much as you like.
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quests.23: Understanding the most popular MC search system. Left Click for more info
JEI (Just Enough Items) is the most downloaded mod ever. It is used to search items and recipes that mods add. As such, it's crucial to understand how JEI works.

Left-clicking on an item or pressing your recipe key ('R' by default) displays all the recipes to craft that item - it won't show anything if there are no recipes to make it, or if it is obtained through a method which doe NOT have JEI support. Right-clicking on an item or pressing your use key ('U' by default) displays all the recipes that use that item - again, if there are none it won't do anything.
You can use the scroll wheel to change pages when viewing recipes. You can also use the 'Backspace' key to go back to the previously viewed recipe.
On the right side of the recipe viewer, you see all the places that recipe can be done in. Due to compatibility issues, it's only most, not literally all.
Pressing your Bookmark key ('A' by default) saves the item to the left side of your inventory. This can be used to keep track of what you intended to do previously.

You can use JEI to seach using substring matching, meaning searching \"coal\" finds both \"Coal\" and \"Charcoal\". You can search for all the items from a mod by using @, for example \"@botania\" finds everything from the Botania mod (if a mod is not visible, it means that it is either not installed, or you don't have access to it yet). You can search for two separate things by separating them with '|' symbol, a vertical line, typically located above the 'Enter' key. You can exclude results by attaching a '-' before it, for example \"-@minecraft\" finds everything that isn't from Vanilla Minecraft. You can also combine these, for example while \"@botan\" would show Botania, BotanyPots and MythicBotany items, you can use \"@botan -@mythic -@pot\" to show only Botania, or you can use for example \"@botan -@mythic -@pot|@astral\" to search for everything in Botania and Astral Sorcery.

If you'd like to import a recipe into a Crafting Table without having to lay it out, you can simply view the recipe in JEI while in the Crafting interface, and left-click the '+' button. That will move all items into the Crafting field. If you'd like to move as many items into the Crafting field from your inventory as possible, hold 'Shift' while pressing the '+' button.
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quests.24: Chopping Trees with STYLE! Left Click for more info
The process of harvesting wood can be quite frustrating at the beginning of a modpack, so, to help you, we've added the Tree Harvester mod.
With it, you can chop down entire Trees just by breaking their base. To use it, break the base of a Tree with an Axe while SNEAKING.
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quests.25: Building with character, duh. Left Click for more info
In the Decursio Project, we're using the Double Slabs mod to assist you, the player, in your building journey.
This mod allows you to place different slabs untop of each other. This means that you can have a block which is half Oak Plank, and half Stone.
With this mod, you can also place Vertical Slabs. And yeah, you can combine those too. To place Vertical Slabs, you'll have to hold down the `Shift` key while placing a Slab.
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quests.26: Crops don't grow at all times! Left Click for more info
In The Decursio Project, we're using the Serene Seasons mod to make the things a little more realistic.
There are 4 Main Seasons and 2 Secondary Seasons for the Tropical Biomes (Desert, Jungle Savannah). Each one of the Main Seasons has 3 individual subcategories. For example, Spring will consist in:

New Worlds will always start in Early Summer. Each sub-season will last for 10 MC days. On a Multiplayer server, the Seasons won't progress if no players are online.                                                                            Seasons will affect the crop fertility (implemented).
While Summers will be warm and cozy, Winters will be cold and harsh. Better start working on a base which will keep you warm during the Winter.

Some Crops will grow only in the Summer time, some crops will grow during Spring and Autumn. When a Crop is planted in another Season then the one that's ideal for it, it will NOT grow. This behavior can be avoided by placing Greenhouse Glass blocks above your crops. Since you won't have access to them from the beginning, you'll have to plan ahead on what crops you wanna grow. Spoiler: We suggest to get your hands on Wheat as soon as you can.
If you wanna see what's the current Season, either, make a Calendar, or look at the icon of this quest.
Lastly, let's return to those 2 Secondary Seasons. Biomes like the Desert, will have Wet and Dry seasons.
In the Tropical Biomes, only Summer crops are in season due to the relatively high temperatures (Other crops can still be grown underground, or using a Greenhouse Glass roof to insulate them).
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quests.27: In our modpack, you'll have to deal with a reduced healing rate.

By deafault, your health is set to regenerate at a downgraded rate of the old, 1.7.10 regen system. While your hunger bar is above a certain level, you'll regenerate one health point every 6 seconds, rather then 2, like it was back in MC 1.7.10.

Additionally, unlike 1.7.10, after you take damage, there will be NO cooldown before you start healing again. Try being very careful in any situation you find yourself. Things WILL eventually get easier as you progress and unlock different items. For now, we highly recommend you to obtain The Sanguine Amulet from Eidolon. You can also make sure you keep a diverse Diet. This will increase your max health to 30 HP.
Lastly, if you're not familiar to how regeneration worked back in 1.7.10, just know that filling up your hunger bar just used to slowly heal half a heart until some of your hunger bar went down.
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quests.28: The Find Me mod is installed. With it, you can hover over an item, press the \"Search Nearby Chests for Items\" key, and then, that item will be showed in the nearest storage block, with white smoke particles
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quests.29: By pressing `U` on an Emerald, you can see what work stations will be required for all the Villager professions available in the game
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quests.30: Nutrition? Minecraft? Whaa....? Left Click for more info
In this pack you'll also have the possibility of gaining bonus effects by keeping a diverse diet. There are 6 nutritional groups you can work with:
Some of these will provide good effects, and some of them will provide bad effects, depending on their value shown in your inventory's Diet menu.
We suggest you visit our Wiki for a more detailed explanation.
ftbquests.chapter.music.title: Music!
ftbquests.chapter.music.quests.0.subtitl: I'm not a saint, but I could be if I try
ftbquests.chapter.music.quests.6.subtitl: Now you're just somebody that I used to know!
ftbquests.chapter.music.quests.8.subtitl: Meh, I'm no music expert, this mod is for my brother
ftbquests.chapter.music.quests.12.title: The Voice of God
Oh, you can't craft this one..WELL...
ftbquests.chapter.music.quests.13.subtit: \"Music speaks louder then words.\" - Kousei Arima
ftbquests.chapter.music.quests.14.subtit: Writing my first song! Left click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.music.quests.14.descri: The music sheet can be used to right a song on portatives.
Sounds follow the chromatic scale with 12 notes per octave and 4 octaves for a total of 48 notes.
11 different tempo settings are available from 60 BPM to 1200 BPM.

You can write music with the mouse or the keyboard, whichever you find comfortable. Keyboard functionality includes the following keys: space, delete, backspace. You can select, copy and paste notes with the 'CTRL + A, CTRL + C, CTRL + V' shortcuts.
You can copy your portatives between different sheets and even outside Minecraft. You can copy them to a text file to back up or paste in another worlds/servers.
You can put up to 5 sheets in the hotbar to see and preview multiple layers of music at the same time when editing. Neighboring sheets can easily be disabled with a button that appears.

You can also prewiev sheets with an instrument in the off hand. Forward, you can lock the instrument per sheet to only preview with that instrument even when your off hand item changes. This can be used to mark which instrument a sheet is supposed to be played with and is also useful with neighboring sheets previews.
ftbquests.chapter.music.quests.15.subtit: The music box will require redstone, a music sheet and an instrument for it to operate. It will use the instrument to play the music sheet, the music sheet to play the specific notes and the redstone signal to actually start playing
ftbquests.chapter.music.quests.16.subtit: Exceptional measurements. Left click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.music.quests.16.descri: A metronome is a device that produces an audible click or other sound at a regular interval, typically in beats per minute (BPM). Metronomes may include synchronized visual motion. Musicians use the device to practise playing to a regular pulse. Many metronomes are now digitized, however minecraft is a CLASSIC, and a classic (more or less) metronome is PERFECT!
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.title: My Colony
