ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.0.sub: Bob The Builder didn't broke my heart! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.0.des: You'll need a builder's hut and a builder to start creating your town. After placing the Builder's Hut, a worker should automatically be assigned to it. You can also manually assign a worker to any structure, including this one.
After a building request was placed, the builder will start working on it. Tools and building materials will need to be provided to them, in order to work. They'll point out any missing items/tools.
After you'll finish the builder's hut, you can start building other houses/structures, including the Townhall.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.1.sub: No, these are not Nexuses. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.1.des: The Guard Tower is an early form of protection for your colony.

The Guard Tower will employ and house 1 Guard to protect your colony. The new Guard will need a bed in a house in order to spawn. However, once they are hired at the Guard Tower, that becomes their new residence and the bed in the house will open up for another new citizen (child or recruit).
The Guard will patrol a set distance around their tower, which is based on their tower’s level.
Note that it is highly recommanded that you build this structure before building houses.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.2.sub: Home, sweet home. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.2.des: Now that you have some protection, you can start building houses. Citizens will go to the House they are assigned to at night to sleep. The House is also a way to get more citizens for your colony.
For additional citizens to spawn, you first have to have enough space in your House(s) to house your first four citizens.

After you have created enough space for your initial four citizens, you have two options for your colony to grow. The first way is to have at least one House at least level 2 that houses two unrelated citizens, which will allow a child to be born in the colony when there is room. You can also make space for a new citizen, go to the Tavern, wait for a traveler to show up, and then give them the items they request to recruit them.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.3.sub: Colony gives auto crafting? Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.3.des: The Blacksmith is a 3x3 crafter and can make any vanilla tools, armor, swords, and shields (no bows or redstone items). The Blacksmith will work when they receive a request for any of those items from another worker.
You will need to teach the Blacksmith the recipes of the items you want them to create. The number of items the Blacksmith can learn are listed below:
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.5.sub: Bread makes them fat! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.5.des: The Baker will craft bread dough, cookie dough, cake dough, and raw pumpkin pie, then bake these in a furnace to create bread, cookies, cakes, and pumpkin pies. They will only do this upon request, whether from the Cook, the postbox, or as a minimum stock in the Warehouse.
The Baker can also craft some non-vanilla breads:
- Sweet bread, made from wheat and a honey bottle. Available at Bakery level 3. Has slightly higher saturation than normal bread, also gives you a speed boost and removes poison.
- Milk-infused bread, made from wheat and a milk bucket. Available at Bakery level 4. Removes all potion effects (like milk buckets do).
- Golden bread, made from wheat and a gold ingot. Available at Bakery level 5. Instantly heals 2 hearts.

- Chorus bread, made from wheat and a chorus fruit. Available after completing the Know the End research in the University. Has higher saturation than normal bread and teleports you to the surface after eating it.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.6.sub: I'm gona take my horse to old town road. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.6.des: The Farm is where the Farmer will grow crops for your colony.
The crops the Farmer currently cultivates are wheat, carrots, potatoes, beets, melons, pumpkins, and most crops from other mods.
Before the Farmer can start, you will have to give the Farmer a hoe, an axe (for harvesting crops), and the crop you want to cultivate.

The Farmer will also craft seeds, carved pumpkins, hay bales, composted dirt, and coarse dirt. They will only make items when they have been taught the recipes, receive a request for an item, and have the needed materials.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.7.sub: sHeEp aUtO WoOl fOoD, yAs! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.7.des: The Shepherd’s Hut is where the Shepherd will breed and butcher sheep for food and wool. You will have to capture and bring in two sheep to the Shepherd’s Hut, as the Shepherd will not catch and bring in any sheep.

The Shepherd will only keep two sheep alive per hut level, so at level 5 they will have ten sheep in their holding pens to breed and butcher. This means they will be faster at producing and collecting meat and wool.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.8.sub: Catching Moby Dick! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.8.des: The Fisher’s Hut is where the Fisher will catch fish.
The Fisher requires a fishing rod and a body of water of a minimum of 7 blocks wide x 7 blocks long x 1 block tall to be able to work, and the water must be near his hut.

Upgrading the Fisher’s Hut will expand the range at which the Fisher can fish, and the higher the level of the Fisher’s Hut, the more loot the Fisher will be fishing out (instead of fish). This includes prismarine and sponges!
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.9.sub: KFC: Kentucky Origins. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.9.des: The Chicken Farmer’s Hut is where the Chicken Farmer will raise chickens, collect eggs, and butcher chickens for food.
You will have to capture and bring in two chickens to the Chicken Farmer’s Hut, as the Chicken Farmer will not catch and bring in any chickens.

The Chicken Farmer will only keep two chickens alive per hut level, so at level 5 they will have ten chickens in their holding pens to breed and butcher. This means they will be faster at producing and collecting meat, drops, and other byproducts, like eggs.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.10.su: Auto citizen feeding. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.10.de: The Restaurant is where the Cook will cook food, provided they have the necessary ingredients and fuel.
When citizens are hungry, they will come to the Restaurant and the Cook will give them food. The Assistant Cook also works at the Restaurant. They craft needed food to help supply the colony.
You can only hire an Assistant Cook when the Restaurant is level 3 or higher.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.11.su: Might as well be a quarry, but not really. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.11.de: The Mine is where the Miner will mine for ores and materials. Once they are hired, the Miner will create a shaft downward and then branch out.
Hint: The shaft the Miner creates downwards will go to a specific depth depending on the level of the Mine.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.12.su: Refined Building Blocks: Part I. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.12.de: The Stone Smeltery is where the Stone Smelter will smelt cobblestone into stone, stone bricks into cracked stone bricks, clay balls into bricks, clay blocks into terracotta, terracotta into glazed terracotta, all types of stone into all types of smooth stone, and logs into charcoal.
They can also pop chorus fruits! The Stone Smelter will only work when they have been taught the recipe, receive a request from another worker, and have the needed materials.
The higher the level of the Stone Smeltery, the more furnaces the Stone Smelter will have available. The number of furnaces they use depends on their Athletics level.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.13.su: Cavemen's macerator. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.13.de: The Sifter’s Hut is where the Sifter will sift through dirt, gravel, sand, or soul sand to find loot. Doing this will make the block the Sifter is sifting disappear.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.14.su: Pig is holy! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.14.de: The Swineherd’s Hut is where the Swineherd will breed and butcher pigs for food.
You will have to capture and bring in two pigs to the Swineherd’s Hut, as the Swineherd will not catch and bring in any pigs.

The Swineherd will only keep two pigs alive per hut level, so at level 5 they will have ten pigs in their holding pens to breed and butcher. This means they will be faster at producing and collecting meat.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.15.su: Central Storage Space. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.15.de: The Warehouse is the central storage from where a Courier will store and retrieve everything your workers harvest, craft, or need. Items will be stored in racks.

The level of the Warehouse will determine how many Couriers will be able to use it at the same time. Level up the Warehouse to increase the amount of Couriers that can work in it. Leveling up the Warehouse will also increase its storage capacity.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.16.su: Protection, protection and PROTECTION. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.16.de: The Barracks is the ultimate protection for your colony. The Barracks will hold 4 Barracks Towers within its structure.

The Barracks Towers (unlike the normal Guard Towers) will employ and house 1 Guard for every level built! Each new Guard will need a bed in a house in order to spawn. However, once they are hired at the Barracks Tower, that becomes their new residence and the bed in the house will open up for another new citizen.
Each Barracks Tower can house and employ 5 Guards for a total of 20 Guards for your colony.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.17.su: Bonus tutela. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.17.de: The Barracks Towers will employ and house 1 Guard for every level built (unlike the normal Guard Towers, which can only have 1 Guard at a time).

Each new Guard will need a bed in a house in order to spawn. However, once they are hired at the Barracks Tower, that becomes their new residence and the bed in the house will open up for another new citizen (child or recruit).
However, once they are hired at the Barracks Tower, that becomes their new residence and the bed in the house will open up for another new citizen (child or recruit).
Guard(s) will patrol a set distance around their tower, which is based on their tower’s level.
If you place Barracks/Barracks Towers near your colony border and level them up, your border will expand.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.18.su: Processing the metal. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.18.de: The Smeltery is where the Smelter will smelt ores into ingots.
The higher the level of the Smeltery, the more furnaces the Smelter will be able to use. A higher level will also have a higher chance to double and even triple the ingot output per block of ore.
The Smelter’s Strength level will sometimes determine the chance to double or triple the ingot output of ores, according to the Smeltery level.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.19.su: From the gates of Valhalla. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.19.de: A Tavern will be very helpful at the beginning, as it will provide housing for up to 4 citizens.
Another feature of the tavern, is that it will attract new citizens which you can recruit.
Keep in mind that the Tavern cannot be upgraded to house more the 4 citizens. Also, your colony can have only one tavern.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.20.su: It all start in kindergarten! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.20.de: Pupils (children) have levels. These can be incresed at The School.
The School is where the Teacher will level up the Pupils’ skills. Paper will increase the leveling speed of the Pupils.
The level of the School determines how many Pupils can be taught at a time.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.21.su: Further, with a degree. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.21.de: The Univerity is the place where you'll teach your citizens the concept of certain buildings, such as the Graveyard. The buildings unlocked in the University are essential for your colony's evolution.
To teach your colony new concepts, a Reseacher will be required, and a reseach tree will be provided.

Once you click on a research tree, you will see the options for each research branch. Each option will tell you the requirements and how long it takes to research that option. The time is real-world time spent in-game. However, Researchers will sometimes use offline time to work on researches. Researchers’ Knowledge skill affects the amount of research time they get from the offline time (it’s not a 1:1 ratio), and their Mana skill affects the max amount of research time they can get.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.22.su: Holding the Lifeline! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.22.de: The Hospital is where injured or sick (yes, they can get sick) citizens go. The Healer will heal them with various items.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.23.su: Merlin of the village. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.23.de: The Enchanter’s Tower is where the Enchanter will create enchanted books, as long as they have Ancient Tomes.

The Enchanter will collect XP from other workers to create the enchanted books. The higher their Mana level, the more XP they will collect per trip. They will not apply the enchanted books to tools and armor, you must do that yourself.
The higher the level of the Enchanter’s Tower, the higher the level of the enchanted books the Enchanter will produce (the Enchanter’s Knowledge level also contributes to this).
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.24.su: This building will boost your citizen's overall happiness just by existing
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.25.su: The beauty of life is the fact that, it doesn't last forever, so every moment is so much special because it's unique. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.25.de: Life can be very diffcult at times and that can bring us lots of pain. Of course, things are much more easier here, as this is just a game, but that doesn't mean you don't have to deal with the consequances of death.

The Undertaker deals with deceased citizens. When a citizen dies, a grave will spawn at the location of death. After a short time, graves will decay and eventually disappear. There are researches to increase this time.

The grave (decayed or not) will hold all the items the citizen had in their inventory at the time of death. The player can right-click the grave to open its inventory and retrieve the items. The Undertaker will walk (run if you’ve completed the relevant research) toward the grave and retrieve its inventory, then go back to the Graveyard.

Once the Undertaker gets to the Graveyard, they will attempt to revive the deceased citizen. The chance for them to succeed can be increased by researches, the Undertaker’s Mana skill, and the level of the Graveyard. The chance is capped at about 10%.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.26.su: Aaand... it all continues in The Library! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.26.de: The Library is a way for you to raise your adult citizens’ Intelligence skill, which influences all other skill increases (at other jobs).

A citizen will randomly level up their Intelligence as long as they’re assigned to the Library. Being a Library Student is their full-time job, so you can’t have one citizen work at the Library and another worker hut at the same time.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.27.su: Knights do need a school too! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.27.de: The Combat Academy is where your Knights in Training will train to become Knight Guards.  This also allows them to level up without a risk of dying to mobs.

A new Knight in Training will need a bed in a house in order to spawn. However, once they are hired at the Combat Academy, that becomes their new residence and the bed in the house will open up for another new citizen (child or recruit).

The Knights in Training require a sword and shield to practice. They will attack the practice dummies, a pumpkin on top of a bale of hay.The Knights in Training are not actual Guards even though they will be dressed as Knight Guards. They will NOT help defend the colony.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.28.su: Legolas for hire! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.28.de: The Archery is where your Archers in Training will train to become Archer Guards. This also allows them to level up without a risk of dying to mobs.

A new Archer in Training will need a bed in a house in order to spawn. However, once they are hired at the Archery, that becomes their new residence and the bed in the house will open up for another new citizen (child or recruit).
The number of students that can be trained at a time depends on the level of the Archery.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.29.su: You're The Mayor! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.29.de: Mine Colonies is a mod which will make your world feel more alive then ever by allowing you to create your own colony.

Now, before starting your colony, it is very important to choose an appropriate place for it. Some biomes might spawn mobs such as Blizzes, Basalzes and more. These mobs, including others, will make the lives of your citizens, a living h3ck. You'll be the mayor, so you'll be responsable for your citizens, even before you'll make the colony. So make sure you choose a safe spot. Best place would be a flat, Plains biome. Make sure you have a well lit area and some walls for defenses.                                                                                      Now, to start building your town, you'll need to place down a Townhall and then, select \"Use Building Tool\".
A nice interface will be provided. Here, you can position your building, rotate it and select, in general, how would you like that building to be placed.
Example of positioning the University structure (press \"Esc\" to look around):

In the top middle menu, you can select the style of your building. In the top right menu, you can select the level of the building. This option is merely for previewing how each level of a building will look like. You'll always start with the first level of a building and you'll end up with the highest level which is usually five.
Each level of a building will change its style and scale and will unlock new abilities.
The Townhall will be the core of your Town. Here you'll be able to inspect your workers, buildings, citizens, stocks and much more.

After placing the Townhall you'll have to create your new colony. After the colony was created, a maximum of 4 citizens will arrive. Houses, food, jobs and other things will have to be provided to your citizens in order to make them happy.
With the Townhall you can only start your colony. Another structure will be required to start actually building things.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.30.su: Jason, but faster. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.30.de: The Courier runs back and forth from the Warehouse to all the worker huts in your colony, delivering materials to workers and putting finished products in the Warehouse.

The level of the Courier’s Hut will dictate how many items the Courier can deliver, so if you want them to carry more materials/tools, upgrade their hut. Upgrading the hut will also increase the amount of requests they can keep track of at a time.
The greater a Courier’s Agility skill, the faster they’ll run. The greater their Adaptability skill, the more huts they can visit before going back to the Warehouse.
YOU MUST BUILD THE WAREHOUSE TO AT LEAST LEVEL 1 SO THE COURIER CAN DO THEIR WORK.

You can have up to 10 Couriers per Warehouse, depending on the Warehouse’s level. The default configuration only allows for 1 Warehouse, but this can be changed. However, Couriers assigned to subsequent Warehouses will only see the items in the Warehouse they are assigned to.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.31.su: 7 days of Lumberjacking. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.31.de: The Forester’s Hut is where the Forester will go in between chopping down trees.
The Forester will cut down any tree in an approximate 150 block area (from themselves) that is not in a hut schematic and doesn’t have cobblestone placed beneath it.
They'll require a hoe to harvest the leaves.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.32.su: Alice's nightmare. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.32.de: The Rabbit Hutch is where the Rabbit Herder will raise and butcher rabbits.
You will have to capture and bring in two rabbits to the Rabbit Hutch, as the Rabbit Herder will not catch and bring in any rabbits.

The Rabbit Herder will only keep two rabbits alive per hut level, so at level 5 they will have ten rabbits in their holding pens to breed and butcher. This means they will be faster at producing and collecting meat and other drops.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.33.su: Honey for days. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.33.de: The Apiary is where the Beekeeper works.
The Beekeeper breeds bees and harvests honeycombs or honey bottles (you can choose which on the second page of the Apiary’s GUI).
The level of the Apiary determines the max number of hives the Beekeeper can take care of.

If the Beekeeper is asking for hives but there are some nearby, make sure you’ve set the hives for them to take care of with the hive tool. This tool is accessed from the second page of the Apiary GUI.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.34.su: Refined Building Blocks: Part 2. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.34.de: The Stonemason’s Hut is where the Stonemason will craft 3x3 recipes made entirely out of cobblestone, stone, andesite, diorite, granite, quartz, purpur, nether bricks, prismarine, sandstones, blackstone, basalt, and/or ores (no ingots or redstone items).
They can also craft end stone from cobblestone and an ender pearl, but only if you have completed the Know the End research in the University.

The Stonemason will only work when they receive a request from another worker and have the needed materials. You will also need to teach the Stonemason’s Hut the recipes you want the Stonemason to craft.
Upgrading the Stonemason’s Hut lets you teach them more recipes, this way:
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.35.su: A piece of jungle in your town. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.35.de: The Plantation is where the Planter will grow either sugar cane, bamboo, or cactus.
The Plantation’s level determines how many crops the Planter can plant at a time.

The Planter can also craft paper, books, sugar, and anything made with bamboo. The Planter will only make these items when they have been taught the recipes, receive a request for an item, and have the needed materials.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.36.su: Craft, fix and repeat. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.36.de: The Mechanic’s Hut is where the Mechanic will craft redstone items, rails, minecarts, clocks, compasses, sea lanterns, torches, lanterns, jack-o-lanterns, storage blocks (like blocks of iron, coal, quartz, etc), dried kelp blocks, blue ice, packed ice, enchantment tables, ender chests, tripwire hooks, sticky pistons, gates, multi-pistons, glowstone blocks, anything made with blaze rods, and many other items that no other crafter can make.

For the Mechanic to work, they must receive a request from another worker and have the necessary materials. The Mechanic’s Hut must also have been taught the crafting recipes for all the items you want the Mechanic to be able to craft.
The number of recipes you can teach the Mechanic’s Hut doubles per building level.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.37.de: The Fletcher’s Hut is where the Fletcher will craft arrows and items that use string or wool, such as bows, fishing poles, and paintings.

For the Fletcher to work, they must receive a request from another worker and have the necessary materials. The Fletcher’s Hut must also have been taught the crafting recipes for all the items you want the Fletcher to be able to craft.
The number of recipes you can teach the Fletcher’s Hut doubles per building level.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.38.su: Color for the weekend. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.38.de: The Dyer’s Hut is where the Dyer will craft dyes and dye other items, including red nether bricks and dark prismarine.
They won’t dye concrete or concrete powder, though. The Dyer will only do this if they receive a request from another worker and have the necessary materials.
The Dyer’s Hut automatically knows how to make green dye and red sand, but you must teach it the recipes for the other dyes and the dyed items.
The number of recipes you can teach the Dyer’s Hut doubles per building level.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.39.su: Fertilizer eaZy. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.39.de: The Composter’s Hut is where the Composter will turn organic materials into compost, which can be used by the Farmer or Florist to fertilize crops or flowers.
They can also create dirt if you have the setting enabled, which the Builder can use in buildings. The Composter uses compost barrels to make compost or dirt.
The higher the level of the Composter’s Hut, the more compost barrels the Composter will be able to use.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.40.su: Making glass can and IS an art. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.40.de: The Glassblower’s Hut is where the Glassblower will smelt sand into glass and make glass panes from glass blocks.

For the Glassblower to work, they must receive a request from another worker and have the necessary materials, including fuel if they’re smelting sand into glass. The Glassblower’s Hut must also have been taught the crafting recipe for glass panes.
The number of recipes you can teach the Glassblower’s Hut doubles per building level.
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.41.su: You can either place down a Supply Camp in which you'll find a Building Tool, or you can just craft it yourself. Either way, this tool will be used a lot in Minecolonies, the mod which will allow you to build a living town in Minecraft
ftbquests.chapter.my_colony.quests.42.su: The Nether Mine is where the Nether Miner works. The Nether Miner travels into the Nether and mines resources found there. The level of the hut determines what items Nether Miner brings back
ftbquests.chapter.optional_challenges.qu: Left click for more information on this chapter
This chapter is filled with optional challenges that you may want to complete. None of these are mandatory, and there really isn't a real reward for completing them.
These are intended mostly for players who just want an extra challenge or objective.
Set up a system that, when given ores, will process them and quintuple the output
Fully automate supplying a Nitro Reactor with Uraninite
Create a maximum size Fission Reactor from Mekanism, and have enough infrastructure to keep it cooled
Automate the production of 64 unique food types
Automate the construction and death of Withers
Automate the production of Mana with the Rafflowsia, with a system that can create and feed it 39 unique flower types
Terraform the planet Mars on an area of 500x500. On the surface only, of course and have a Colony of Villagers there.
Gather all the hats from the Hats mod
Create a setup which can produce 5 Red Matters/Hour without having any EMC interractions being a part of it
Create a Computercraft setup which would be able to control and regulate a Draconic Reactor on its own

ftbquests.chapter.oregen.quests.35.subti: Spawns in OverWorld = Min Y:0 - Max Y:16
ftbquests.chapter.oregen.quests.36.title: Alfheim Flux Ore
ftbquests.chapter.oregen.quests.36.subti: Spawns in Alfheim = Min Y:2 - Max Y:35
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.title: OverWorld
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.0.tit: Pyramids, yes, but for what Pharaoh?
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.0.sub: Is that a.. Ice Pyramid? Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.0.des: Repurposed Structures adds 10 new versions of the desert pyramid from vanilla Minecraft. Try to find all of them.
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.0.tas: Find all the pyramids from Repurposed Structures
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.1.sub: The vanilla-like structures that you'll find in your world are added by this mod
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.1.tas: Ender a newly generated world and by gifted with the beauty of the new generated structures
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.2.sub: The Pillager Outpost has now 14 versions. Try to find them all
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.3.sub: Trades, trades for everyone! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.3.des: There are 10 types of villages. If you manage to encounter all of them, this gift shall be yours.
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.3.tas: Find all the Villages added by Repurposed Structures
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.4.sub: The Witch Huts have now 4 versions. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.4.des: The reward for the quest is The Top Hat from Eidolon. This item is special because it is indeed craftable, but its recipe is a secret.
The mod's author keeps this item's recipe a secret because it is merely an easter egg item, so, if you want this, but have no idea how to craft it, you can get it from this quest.
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.4.tas: Find all the Witch Huts added by Repurposed Structures
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.5.tas: Find all the Shipwrecks from Repurposed Structures
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.6.tas: Find all the Mineshafts added by Repurposed Structures
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.7.sub: Resident Evi...a...Illagers..? Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.7.des: Yeah, mensions. There are 7 variants of that structure. If you find them all, you can have this gift. In 3 years I couldn't find even the vanilla one.. yeey..
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.7.tas: Find all the Mansions added by Repurposed Structures
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.8.sub: Tame an Elephant by feeding it Acacia Blossoms
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.9.sub: Tame a Tarantula Hawk with spider eyes
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.10.su: Obtain every single armor piece added by Alex's Mobs
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.11.su: There's a reason this mod is so popular. The mobs added by it, actually DO things
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.12.su: Obtain a Rodrunner Feather is has many uses in the Alex's Mobs mod
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.13.su: Blob Fish can be used to make fish oil
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.14.su: A Grizzly Bear can be tamed by feeding it with Honeycombs. After that, feed it with Salmon. If you are lucky, you'll get a new best friend
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.15.su: Tamed Grizzly Bears will occasionally drop hair. This hair can also be dropped by regular Grizzly Bears when killed
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.16.su: Tame a Bald Eagle with fish oil
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.17.su: Use a Falconry Glove, made of leather and bear hair, to launch a tamed Bald Eagle
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.17.ta: Use it to launch a tamed Eagle
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.19.su: Apple of the jungle. Break jungle leaves to obtain bananas
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.21.su: Tame a Capuchin Monkey with bananas
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.22.su: Find a Guster in the desert
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.23.su: A pocket with sand can be used as a ranged weapon. Sand will be require as ammo
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.24.su: When provided a redstone signal, this block can make Gusters
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.25.su: Give a maraca to a Cockroach. If you're lucky, you might get a Sombrero!
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.26.su: Tame a Mantis Shrimp with tropical fish. After that, give the shrimp a bucket of water, so it can live on the land forever
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.27.su: Cachalot Whales may spawn washed up on beaches. They are helpless in this form, and if pushed back into the water without being hurt, they may decide to reward their saviors. The reward for this task is in the form of Ambergris, a valuable product of the whale's stomach that is coughed up. Ambergris can be traded to fishermen villagers for a great deal of emeralds, or can be used to craft an Echolocator. It can also be used as a powerful fuel that can smelt 64 items
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.28.su: See those cool structures? Yeah, this mod adds them
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.28.ta: Enter a newly generated world and observe the beauty of the new structures
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.33.su: Word is, the wandering trader was once part of this camp
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.35.su: Who killed this thing? Really? WHAT KILLED THIS THING?!
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.39.su: Yes, you could make a wish hear, but its main point is to give ceratin effects to players. Just jump in them
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.39.ta: Jump in one of these wells
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.43.ti: N.Y.A.V.F.T. - Not Your Average Venus Fly Trap
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.43.su: Now you're my plant. Defeating a Foliaath has a chance of rewarding you with a Foliaath Seed, with which you can grow your own Foliaath. However, this quest will give you the seed anyway
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.44.su: To defeat this ancient warrior, you'll have to dodge he's attacks. At a point he'll slamm he's battle axe in the ground, getting it stuck. This moment will be your chance to strike back. You'll have to go behind him and hit the sword stuck in he's back. Defeating The Ferrous Wroughtnaut will give you he's axe and helmet
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.45.su: Only if this mod had more mobs.. :(
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.46.su: The FrostMaw is a cold and very dangerous beast. While adventuring, you might encounter this creature in icy biomes. Lucky for you, Frostmaws spend most of their time sleeping. If you manage to wake up one of them, you either are unlucky, or just a little crazy. However, battling a Frostmaw might prove itself a very rewarding challenge, as they often drop an Ice Crystal when killed
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.47.su: Remember that Ice Crystal? Well.. you can steal it from a Frostmaw. Just try not to wake it up
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.47.ta: Steal the Ice Crystal from a FrostMaw
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.48.su: It's not from Twilight and certainly its not Korra's friend. Nagas can be found throughout the Overworld. When defeated, they have a chance of dropping a Naga Fang which can be used to craft a dangerous dagger. This quest will give you the dagger regardless of the Naga dropping its fang or not
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.49.su: Oh, you're not bald? Enter a Barakoa Camp without being noticed
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.49.ta: Enter a Barakoa Camp without being noticed
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.50.su: Barakoanas will drop their masks. These will give you certain effects when worn
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.51.su: Defeating the Sun Chief, will reward you with The Sol Visage. This mask will give you the ability to summon your own Barakoanas. You'll just need their masks to do so
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.53.su: This tiny creatures can be found underground. However you'll quickly discover that they're quite shy, as they'll hide when a player approaches. These creatures can be defeated with a pickaxe. They'll drop some minerals
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.54.ti: You're my frien' now. Here're having soft tacos later
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.54.su: With a pickaxe with silk touch, you can pick up this tiny creature
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.55.su: Using a fortune pickaxe on a Grottol will give you more drops
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.56.de: OverWorld - The place where all begins. As a dimensional adventurer you'll have to move towards the depths of The Nether.
Also, the heights of space are available for you to conquare too.
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.57.su: The trash can will act like a vanilla composter, but instead of bone meal, it will give you garbage blocks which you might find to be useful
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.58.su: When the Garbage Piles are placed in an area with a low light level, they'll have a random chance to spawn rats
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.59.su: The Compressed Garbage has a higher chance to spawn rats
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.60.su: When used on a rat, it will turn that rat into The Rat King
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.61.su: Defeating The Rat King will give you some Tangled Rat Tails which can be used to make a Gilded Rat Flute. With it, you'll be able to launch rats at a target. Finishing this quest, will give you a Smile in a Bucket, as a reward. With it, you can find Slime Chunks. When you enter a Slime Chunk, the Slime in the Bucket will start to jump around
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.62.su: Plague Essence can be considered the source of the plague itself. It can be used to obtain items which might be related with the plague's lore
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.63.su: When applied to a Villager, they'll will be transformed into a Plague Doctor which will sell valuable items. It can also be used to make the Plague Tome
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.64.su: This book can be obtained in two ways. First, you can craft it and secondly, you can obtaine it from a Plague Doctor. It can be used in some recipes, but it also has another use. When applied to a Plague Doctor, they'll turn into The Black Death, which will be a powerful Boss
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.65.su: Unlike a regular Rats experiance, The Black Death will NOT drop he's scythe. However, you can defeat him for his mask which is a nice trophy. Additionally, you'll receive a pretty unique item as a reward for defeating him. The Earthbore Gauntlet will allow you to become the Worm-Man. Now, unlike other superheroes out there, the Worm-Man doesn't have so many amazing abilities, but their main ability might prove to be useful in some critical situations. You'll be able to travel through dirt and stone just like a.. well... worm. Yep. That's it. Just that. There's nothing more. We mean it. Stop reading. No, seriously, what are you still doing here? Go finish the pack already! PS: The Gauntlet can be used for a limited amount of time, after that, you'll have to wait. It is also A M A Z I N G!
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.66.su: Uncommon Eidolon dust. Serves as the base for multiple magic items
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.67.su: Making some PowerPuff stuff. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.67.de: The Chemical X is a very dangerous and unstable compund which can be used to create some.. not so friendly creatures.
When it is thrown at a variety of mobs, certain Mutant Creatures might be created. Let's see what these Creatures are:

Each of these Creatures have unique interactions with you. Some of them will be agressive, while some of them will be quite useful. Each of these hase special quests dedicated to them, so make sure to check those out to see more info about these.
The Chemical X can be created by either using the recipe provided by JEI, or by making it in a brewing stand.
You'll need to make slash water bottles. After that, add a piece of glowstone and finally, add any item dropped by a Mutant Creature. This way you can create 3 flasks for Chemical X at a time.
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.68.su: The Dead Walking are buffed. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.68.de: The Mutant Zombie can be created by throwing a flask of Chemical X at a regular Zombie. There's a 60% chance for the Mutant varient to be created.
The Mutant Zombie is a very large and intimidating creature which will be agressive towards you.

This Mini-Boss (yeah, you can consider it a Mini-Boss) will give you a nice reward for defeating it. This will be the Hulk Hammer. You can use it as a powerful melee weapon as it will deal 9 attack damage. Additionally, it will allow you to create shock waves on the ground by simply right-clicking the ground with it.

A thing that should be mentioned, is that fact that, unlike other mobs, or mini-bosses, The Mutant Zombie will be revived after you defeat it. While it's down, you can light it on fire with a Flint and Steel to defeat it. If no fire is provided, you'll have to defeat The Mutant Zombie three additional times.
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.69.su: The Living Dynamite. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.69.de: The Mutant Creeper will be created by throwing a flask of Chemical X at a regular Creeper. There will be, however, a 60% chance for the Mutant variant to be created.

The Mutant Creeper will have a total amount if 120 health points. Additionally, we're advicing a set of armor enchanted with blast protection, as this creature has a total amount of five attack tactics. Let's see them:
- Jump Attack: The Mutant Creeper will jump in the air and, upon landing, a massive explosion will be created.
- Minion Spawning: The Mutant Creeper will create Creeper Mininons that will target you and will unleash a tiny explosion after getting close enough to you.

- Charge Attack: The Charge Attack can be considered a risk-reward period for you. In this state, The Mutant Creeper will flash for five times. In the meantime, you can attack the Creeper to inflict a great amount of damage, eventually breaking it out of this Charging Attack state. Howeve, if you fail to break it out of it, it'll gain some health back.

- Lightning Attack: Each time The Mutant Crepeer charges itself, there's a small chance that a lightinin bolt will be summoned to turn it into a Charged Mutant Creeper. This version will create more powerful explosions. Its minions will actually be more stronger too.
- Healing: DO NOT try under any circumstances to defeat The Mutant Creeper by using explosions. These will only heal it.

Finally, after you manage to drain all the life out of The Mutant Creeper, you should start running, as it will prepare to unleash the last explosion which will be very powerful. After the explosion was unleashed, The Mutant Crepeer will be finally, dead.
Upon defeating it, you'll be rewarded with a Creeper Minion Egg. This thing will hatch in 5 days. Additionally you can speed up this process by exploding the Egg.
If you break the Egg before it hatches, there's a chance you might get a Creeper Shard which can be used to create explosions at you possition. Also it can be used to make a Creeper Minion Tracker.
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.70.su: Nightmares of the End. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.70.de: The Mutant Enderman can be created by throwing a flask of Chemical X at a regular Enderman.
Be ready because this Creature might be your demise. It has 200 health and does a lot of damage and has a lot of attacks involving teleportation of itself and even you.

Upon defeating this creature, it will create some Endersoul Fragments which you can collect by right-clicking them before they explode. After that, you'll have to shift right-click them. Lastly, just throw and eye of ender (which can be dropped by the Mutant Enderman) to obtain an Endersoul Hand.
This legendary item can be used to pick up and throw block at your enemies. Additionally, you can shift right-click with it to teleport at the location you're looking at.
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.71.su: Is it really a Mutant, or is it a Worrior? Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.71.de: The Mutant Skeleton can be created by throwing a flask of Chemical X at a regualr Skeleton. There's a 60% chance for the Mutant varient to be created.

The Mutant Skeleton will be agressive towards you, so be ready to face it, at it has very powerful attacks (including ranged and melee) which can inflict negative potion effects and a total amount of 150 health.

Fighting this Mini-Boss and winning will reward you with the required components to build a Mutant Skeleton set of Armor. This set will provide Speed/SpeedII and Jump Bosst II and iron-level of protection.
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.72.su: The Spider-Pig thing. No Spider-Ham, unfortunately. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.72.de: The Spider-Pig is a strange abomination which can be created by throwing a flask of Chemical X on a Pig which was recently fed with a Fermented Spider Eye.

This Creature will not be agressive towards you. It can actually be tamed. By blowing it with your Creeper Minion, it will be tamed and will allow you to place a saddle on it and ride it. While riding it, you can make a speed dash by using space and you can climb up walls.
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.73.su: Do you want to build a Mutant Snowman? Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.73.de: The Mutant Snow Golem, just like with all the other Mutant Creatures, can be created by throwing a flask of Chemical X on a regular Snow Golem.

This Creature will assist you in combat, just like the regular Snow Golem would do. You can right-click on it to make it follow you. It will attack all the nearby hostile mobs and will freeze any water blocks present and will create snow paths. If it's health goes low, you can throw snow balls at it to heal it.
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.74.su: Commands upon commands. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.74.de: This handy device can be used to control your Creeper Minion more intensively. By right-clicking a Creeper Minion with this tool, a nice interface will be made visible. From here, you can select if your Minion can destroy blocks, if it has its name shown above its head, or if it can stand on you or not.
If the later option is enabled, you can carry your Minion by getting very close to it. Shift will bring it down.

This tool can also be used to track the Minion's explosive charge. When your minion it's in \"one-time\" mode, it will be able to unleash just one explosion before dying. Feed it with TNT to place it into \"Continuos\" mode.
If a Spider-Pig gets blown by your Creeper Minion, it might become tamed.
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.75.su: Gift from Poseidon. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quests.75.de: The Neptun's Bounty can be obtained by Fishing. A highly enchanted Diamond Fishing Rod is adviced for this, as this tresure is a very rare drop.
You can find the follwing items in the Bounty:
ftbquests.chapter.protection_1.title: Protection - 1
Starting Adventurer: This armor will be your starting point in the defensive department
Pantless Merlin: No pants? A true magician NEVER WEARS PANTS! Left Click for more info
When worn, provides mitigation of certain bad effects. Also gives you a magic damage boost.
This armor set does NOT include a pair of pants.
Son of Poseidon: Gives you total advantage under water
Resourceful Tinkerer: If you made this armor, it is most likely because you'll upgrade it to something better. You also could've made it just because you like it. Yeah. That's fair. Just that. Yeah.
The Bloody Cultist. Left Click for the recipes and more info

This armor will be your ultimate defense against The Wither, as it will negate the wither effect and will provide strenght while you're in The Nether. To see the recipe for the armor, press \"U\" on Crimson Weave.
Additionaly, this armor will give you permanent potion effects based on the dimension you are in:
These effects can be amplified if a Blood Flask is used in combination with this armor. You can find more info about the Blood Flask in the \"Useful Items\" tab.

Another feature provided by this armor will be a Blood Bar. Think of it as a rage mod. Simply kill mobs and it will slowly fill up. When it's full, you can active the Blood Aura. When it is turned on, you'll receive Regeneration III as long as you have Blood on that Bar.
This Bar can also be used with the Scepter of Blood and the Sanguine Scythe to unlock some powerful ranged attacks.
Recipes won't be visible on Multiplayer, so here you go:
Basic Tinkerer: Well.. you got to see this too. Tinkers has armors now. This set of armor can be modified with resistance towards fire, explosions and others. Applying upgrades such as Diamonds to it, will boots its protection
BlingBling-man: Useful in The Nether, keeping Hoglins at bay
Bone Worrior: This Armor will provide Speed/Speed II (depending if youre running or not) and Jump Boost. Iron-level of protection will be granted
Forest Soldier: This Armor will provide protection between the Leather and the Chanin levels, giving a total amount of 10 Armor Points. It is also more durable then the Leather Armor
ftbquests.chapter.protection_2.title: Protection - 2
Knight in a shiny armor: Minecraft's most iconic armor. Provides high protection and looks stunning
Nether Worrior: An upgrade to The Diamond Armor. Provides even better protection then its shiny counterpart and it will not be destroyed when dropped in fire or lava. Additionally, it will reduce the amount of knockback you receive
Midgard Soldier: Similar to The Iron Armor. It will draw mana from its wearer's inventory to repair itself
Midgard Guardian: An upgrade of The ManaSteel Armor. Provides high protection, also decreases the mana cost for certain actions
Starting Botanist: This lightweight robe will decreases the mana cost of certain actions just for some manaweave cloth. Fun fact, durring Christmas, this armor will change its appearance into a bright red
Arcane Soldier: Gives the ability of infusing certain spells into the armor, much like a modular suit
Classic Knight: Minecraft's most used set of armor. It provides decent protection
Create-Man MkI: Even though it doesn't have any flamethrowers, this reddish exoskeleton can enhance your speed and strenght, all at the cost of some fuel and some mining fatigue. Left Click for more info
To power the exoskeleton and the leggings, hold them in your left hand and drop the fuel with the right hand. You can use coal or wood as fuel.
The boots of this armor will not allow you to swim. This can be a great thing if you're planning on building a base under water. Using the Copper Backtank is adviced if you're gonna do that.
Additionally, wearing the boots, will allow you to stand on convoyer belts without being pushed.
Create-Man MkII: Through the power of brass, you are able to make a better version of your original armor, giving you even better reflexes and protection. Additionally, you can make a modified version of the exoskeleton which will allow you to fly. No mining fatigue will be given, also swiming will be possible here
Purple Tinkerer: Second tier of tinkers armor, this will be focused on defense, rather then modularity
ftbquests.chapter.protection_2.quests.10: By default, the Mantle of stars is just a powerful Chestplate. However, it can be attuned to one of 11 constellations to obtain certain abilities
ftbquests.chapter.protection_2.quests.11: Will allow you to accumulate all the damage you take, to reflect it later upon your enemies, by hitting them. Kinda similar to Marvel's Vibranium, but it will allow you to reflect the damage for multiple hits
ftbquests.chapter.protection_2.quests.13: Will allow you to walk on air. Ascending/descending will consume starlight. Additionally, it will heal you regardless of your hunger bar being full or not
ftbquests.chapter.protection_2.quests.14: Will give you 3 shield charges which will negate 100% of all the damage you take from 3 hits
ftbquests.chapter.protection_2.quests.15: Will give you advantages underwater, such as increased swimming/movement speed, increase mining speed and so on
ftbquests.chapter.protection_2.quests.16: If you hold a block in your hand, it will highlight it, so you can see it much easier. Kinda acts like an X-ray
ftbquests.chapter.protection_2.quests.17: Will summon \"minions\" which will assist you in combat
ftbquests.chapter.protection_2.quests.18: When you break a block using its apropriate tool, a minion will be summoned to help you with your task. This also works with swords when fighting an enemie, as a minion will be summoned to assist you in your battle
ftbquests.chapter.protection_2.quests.19: Will make the fire damage you take, will be casted upon the Mantle's durability, instead of you
ftbquests.chapter.protection_2.quests.20: Will allow you to stop time for some mobs around you
ftbquests.chapter.protection_2.quests.21: Will give you the ability to see containers, spawners and entities throw walls
ftbquests.chapter.protection_2.quests.22: Electric Shielding: The Faraday set will allow you to pass by a Tesla Coil in low-power mode, without being electrocuted. In high-power mode however, it increases the damage dealt to you
ftbquests.chapter.protection_3.title: Protection - 3
Not your Barbie Girl - Part 1: The Elementium armor will spawn pixies to assist you in battle
Not Your Barbie Girl - Part 2: The Archmage robe will maximize your mana level, allowing you to cast more powerful spells
Alfheim Explorer: Upgraded version of The TerraSteel Armor. Unlike its TerraSteel counterpart, this armor will provide speed, higher reach, jump boost and more
The Mark 86: A modular Power-Suit. Fully working on electricity and highly costomizable. Has a menu which can be accessed from the \"\\\" key. There you'll be able to configure the suit's modules and more
The Electric Knight: The Flux-Infused Armor will provide great protection when it's charged with RF. Additionally, each piece will give a charge of flux shielding. A charge can block any instance of damage up to 500 damage points. Charges regenerate after 30 seconds
Will allow the Helmet of the MekaSuit to be filled with Nutritional Paste. While wearing the Helmet, you'll be fed with nutritional paste. Effectively removing the need of eating
Will provide a night vision feature to the Helmet of the MekaSuit. Multiple of these will enhance the night vision feature further
Will charge the Helmet of the MekaSuit while it's daytime and no solid blocks are above your head
Will provide step asist to the MekaSuit. Additionally, will make you jump higher
Will allow you to run faster and jump for longer distances
ftbquests.chapter.protection_3.quests.10: Will show the amount of radiation you've been exposed to
ftbquests.chapter.protection_3.quests.11: Will make the Helmet of the MekaSuit release small pulses of electricity to turn the nearby water into oxygen which you can breathe. Shortly, this allows you to breathe underwater
ftbquests.chapter.protection_3.quests.12: Will allow you to defy gravity. And yeah. This is just a fancy way of saying that this thing will allow the MekaSuit to perform Creative Flight
ftbquests.chapter.protection_3.quests.13: Will equally distribute the energy through the whole MekaSuit
ftbquests.chapter.protection_3.quests.14: Will increase the energy storage capacity of any piece of Meka-Equipment
ftbquests.chapter.protection_3.quests.15: Will essentially integrate the features of the Hazmat Suit, into the MekaSuit, effectively allowing the Mekasuit to protect you against radiation
ftbquests.chapter.protection_3.quests.16: Will attract nearby dropped items to you. Use the configuration menu of the MekaSuit to adjust the strenght of the modules
ftbquests.chapter.protection_3.quests.17: Will negate potion effects. In the Configuration Menu of the MekaSuit you can select if good potion effects should also be negated or not
ftbquests.chapter.protection_3.quests.18: Will enhance the ability of the MekaSuit to withstand direct hits from Laser beams
ftbquests.chapter.protection_3.quests.19: Will show the amount of radiation present in the nearby environment
ftbquests.chapter.protection_3.quests.20: By dispersing hydrogen, this module will freeze the water underneath you. Use the Configuration Menu of the MekaSuit to disable this module of the field
ftbquests.chapter.protection_3.quests.21: Will give power to the Pants from the MekaSuit while you're on fier. Additionally it will reduce the damage you receive from heat sources
ftbquests.chapter.protection_3.quests.22: Gliding Forever. Left Click for more info

The Flux-Infused Elytra may be the best randition of an upgraded Elytra until this point. It is ment ot be used with a Flux-Infused Elytra Controller. Without it, it will be just a regualar Elytra, but powered by RF.
While gliding, a Right-Click with the Controller will boost you forwards, just like a regular Firework would. This action will consume some additional power.

When the Elytra is Empowered (Empowering the Controller will also Empower the Elytra for conveniance) you'll receive a constant boost forward. This will consume more power at a constant rate, but you'll basically become Iron Man, so we'd say it's worth it.
Oh, one last thing. The Flux-Infused Elytra provides 5 points of protection. A regular Elytra has no protection, and a Flux-Infused Chestplate has 8 protection points.
ftbquests.chapter.protection_4.title: Protection - 4
The Crimson Knight: The Red Matter armor is a minor upgrade to the Dark Matter Armor. It will give you 90% damage reduction. Fall Damage is reduce with this Armor, same with the Explosion Damage
Molecular Batman: Since Batman is Batman, with this armor you'll be Batman too. While wearing a full set, you'll get a damage reduction of 80% While this doesn't sound like much, it basically means that not a lot of thing will be able to kill you. This includes even the Chaos Guardian. However, Fall Damage and Explosions might still kill you
Energy Shields - Part 1: The Wyvern Chest Piece is a modular item added by Draconic Evolution. Without modules, it is useless. Its module inventory can be accessed through the 'Tool Module' key (you'll have to bind it in the Controls menu). It can accept Wyvern Tier Modules. It has 30 slots available. Be aware that some Modules may take more then one Module Slot. Lastly, note that all the Chest Pieces are curios, items so you can combine them with any set of armor you want
Energy Shields - Part 2: The Draconic Chest Piece has 48 Module Slots available. It will also allow you to install Draconic Tiers of modules
The Crimson Lord: Chaos Guardian? I bet you're kidding. Left Click for more info
The Gem Armor is one of the most advanced and expensive armors in The Decursio Project.
It offers many offensive abilities and utilities, such as Jetpack-Like Flight (just hold down the 'Spacebar') and Creative Flight (double tap the 'Spacebar').
It will also give you a permanent speed boost. The Boots can provide Step Assist if the feature's toggled through the special key. Same thing goes for the Helmet with its Night Vision feature.
While holding 'Shift', all the nearby mobs will be repealed from you.
We recommend using this armor with a Chest Piece from Draconic Evolution.
The Little Devil: The Supremium Armor is a modular set added by Mystical Agriculture. With it, you can increase your max health, have creative flight and more. All of these features will require a Tinker Table from Mystical Agriculture, and Augments
Energy Shields - Part 3: The Chaotic Chest Piece has 80 Module Slots available. It will also allow you to install Chaotic Tiers of modules
ftbquests.chapter.relics.title: Relics \\& Artifacts
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.0.subtit: On a hurry? Drink that liquid! (Blue Edition): Decreases the time it takes to consume drinkable items
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.1.subtit: Power Man: Will increase the damage dealt by the wearer
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.2.subtit: Emergency Multitool: Your fist becomes a stone tier tool
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.3.subtit: The Friend of Thor: Provides a chance for your attacks to summon lightining
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.4.subtit: Churchless Priest: Increases the lenghts of invincibility after taking damage
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.5.subtit: Cheap Invisibility Cloak: Turns the wearer invisible
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.6.subtit: Champion Athlete: Will give you a speed boost and step asist while running
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.7.subtit: SSss repealer: Creepers are afraid of the wearer
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.8.subtit: The non-007 Agent: Gives Night Vision
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.9.subtit: Short nose? No problem: Decreases the prices when trading with Villagers
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.10.subti: Obsidian Shielding: Gives temporar imunity to fire damage
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.11.subti: Redstone Engineer's Knockback: Your hit's knockback will be boosted
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.12.subti: The Half-Cure: Will reduce the duration of negative effects
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.13.subti: The Health Line: Will increase the wearer's maximum health by a flat amount
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.14.subti: The totally useful curio: Increases the wearer's flatulance
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.15.subti: SubnautiCraft: Increases the wearer's swimming speed
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.16.subti: Bunny Hop: Allows the wearer to double jump
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.17.subti: Cheat Day! Left click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.17.descr: Unlike other artifacts, the Everlasting Beef can be obtained as a random drop from a cow. Cook it to get the Eternal Steak.
Keep in mind that eating the Eternal Steak, has a cooldown. Additionally, it will not contribute to your general nutrition levels.
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.18.subti: Combusting Firefly: Has a chance to light attackers on fire, similar to the \"thorns\" enchantment, but with fire
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.19.subti: Jack hunts for XP: The mobs you kill will drop more XP, especially the mobs which you haven't killed in awhile
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.20.subti: Life Stealer: Each hit you deal to a mob, will give you some health
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.21.subti: No. You're not a vampire: Acts both as a Shield and as a Glider
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.22.subti: On a hurry? Drink that liquid! (Orange Edition): Decreases the time it takes to consume drinkable items
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.23.subti: Magma Bender: Each hit you deal will ignite enemies on fire
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.24.subti: The Green Panther: Increses your attack speed. Does NOT give haste
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.25.subti: The Green Rose: Has a chance do deal damage to attackers, similar to the \"thorns\" enchantment
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.26.subti: Scared Cat: After taking damage, your movement speed will be increased
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.27.subti: Cold, Lucky Miner: Gives an extra level of fortune to the mined blocks
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.29.subti: Jazz JackRabbits: Increses the wearer's jump height. Also negates fall damage
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.30.subti: Diver Level I: Gives Water Breathing
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.31.subti: Looting Goblin: Applies an extra level of looting to killed entities
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.33.subti: The Starfury. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.33.descr: A Belt will be required to wear this Relic in the Talisman Slot.
- When dealing damage to an entity, has a 15% chance to summon a falling star, which deals 75% of the damage dealt when the star was summoned
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.34.subti: The Holy Cross: You deal 50% more damage to undead mobs and there's a 25% chance that you'll set them on fire. Additionally, you gain 25% faster regeneration rate
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.35.subti: Adept of the sand dunes. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.35.descr: A Belt will be required to wear this Relic.
- Grants 50% speed in desert like biomes
- While holding \"alt\", you can press one of your ability keys (you'll have to bind them in the controls menu) to burry yourself in the block beneath you
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.36.subti: The Poison Projectile-Trap: When firing a bow, there a 30% chance that the arrows you shoot will unleash a poisonous cloud which will deal damage to the nearby mobs in an area of 3x3. A Belt, or another Curios item which would provide some Talisman Slots will be required to equip the item
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.37.subti: The Queen Bee: Each Bee in a radius of 16 block will gifht along side you. Additionally, for each Bee which is fighting with you, your regeneration will be increased by 0.5
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.38.subti: Fire Bravity: Will absorb the fire sources nearby to allow you to levitate. This is similar to flying, but not really. If you're not careful, you'll still be able to fall to your death, or not reach hight places. You'll slowly loose your charges if you'll make contact with Water
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.39.subti: Assistant Disk Thrower: Fires a projectile which will bounce up to 10 times and deals 5 damage. It refills one charge every 10 seconds
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.40.subti: The Life Anchor: After right-clicking with it, it will remember you position and will return you to it after 30 seconds at the cost of some xp. In this 30 secods interval, if you take fatal damage, you'll instantly be teleported to the previous location, but the relic will be reduced to 0 durability
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.41.subti: The Gateway Frisbee: By right-clicking with this relic, you can throw a disk which will bounce up to 10 times from walls. It will NOT bounce from mobs, so be careful how you throw the disk. A thrown disk, can be reccaled by pressing right-click again. If you press shift right-click after a disk has been thrown, you'll be teleported a the disk's curret location
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.42.subti: The relic of Vulgrim. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.42.descr: A Belt will be required to wear this Relic.
- Absorbs the souls of the defeated mobs. Each soul grants 0.1% more damage to the wearer
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.43.subti: Spawn Anchor: If you've played Terraria, you know what this does. If you haven't played Terraria, this will teleport you back to your spawnpoint when you right-click on it
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.44.subti: Stick-em Powers!: Will allow you to climb walls just like Pete does
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.45.subti: Charged Jelly: You gain 200% regeneration while underwater and 25% magic resistance, while you get a 25% reduction in swiming speed. If you're holding \"alt\", you can press the ability key (you'll have to bind it in the controls menu) for a boost underwater
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.46.subti: Vibranium Necklace?: Will accumulate 5 shields over some time. The shields will absorb incoming damage and will reflect 50% of it back to the attacker at the cost of one shield
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.47.subti: The Enderman Gateway: Will allow you to switch places with the Enderman you're looking at. Endermans will be neutral towards you. Lastly, by holding \"alt\", you can press one of the ability keys (you'll have to bind them in the controls menu) to open an Ender Chest.
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.48.subti: Uncontrolled Fury: Each hit you deal in the span of 3 seconds, will raise exponentially in the amount of damage you deal
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.49.subti: Low-ping Amplifier: Will postpone any healing or damage taken for 10 seconds. This might be very helpful as it will give you some time to heal yourself with any resources you've got. After the 10 seconds delay passes, all the damage and healing you've got, will be stacked, so you might have a chance to survive
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.50.subti: Grass Tiger: You become invisible while standing in Tallgrass
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.51.subti: Bastion Hunter: Piglins will be passive towards the wearer. Also, they'll point out the location of the nearest Bastion
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.52.subti: Ender Rocket: Consumes Dragon's Breath to boost the Elytra. Does not require fuel in The End
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.53.subti: Hawkeye of the blocklands: Will allow you to draw your bow faster. While pressing the ability key (you'll have to bind it in the controls menu), you can launch explosive arrows
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.54.subti: Cloak of Invisibility: Makes you invisible in dark areas. Also gives you 50% speed during night time
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.55.subti: The Chorus Anchor: Stabilizes the Chorus Fruts. After Eating them, you'll be teleported along the line of sight within 50 blocks
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.56.subti: Underwater Zombie: A Trident with \"Riptide\" can be used even if you're not in contact with water. You'll deal 200% more damage underwater, but you'll receive 50% more damage
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.57.subti: Kraven The Looter: Gives Looting I and 200% damage to your pets
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.58.subti: Fortune booster: Will increase your looting and luck levels by 25%
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.59.subti: Yuri!!! On Ice: You get 10% more movement speed while on ice. Additionally, you'll damage the mobs you collide with
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.60.subti: Heat Walker: Will give you protection against the damage given by hot blocks. Additionally, it will solidify lava, so you can walk on it, just like you would with the FrostWalker enchantment in vanilla
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.61.subti: The Ground Pound: It will decrease your movement speed by 10%, while increasing your falling speed by 7%. It will greartly reduce the amount of knockback you take. Lastly, while falling, you can hold shift to create a powerful shockwave
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.62.subti: I believe I can fly: Will allow the wearer to swim through the air for short amounts of time, kinda similar to flying
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.63.subti: You can catch them while fishing. Additionally, this will give you a 5% movement speed bonus
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.64.subti: Matt Stonie's Breakfast: The Infinity Ham will allow you to eat from it 4 tymes before it will start to recharge. You can eat from it basically forever, but keep in mind that it will not contribute to your general nutricion levels
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.65.subti: The Squishy Heart: Ever worn slime boots? Well, now you don't have to. This Relic will allow you to become bouncy. Also, it will reduce your renegeration rate by 25%
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.66.subti: Raising Speed: Will give you step assist while running. Besides this, the longer you go, the faster you'll move
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.67.subti: Froggy: This relic will give you 25% swimming speed. Additionally it will give you a 2x air supply. This will make your oxigen level drop much slower
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.68.title: The mimic
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.68.subti: You can obtain Artifacts by killing Mimic Chests which can be found underground
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.69.subti: Premium Ocarina: Will summon your horse at your current location
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.70.subti: Unlike other Relics, this one is CRAFTABLE! Handy for any superhero: Gives 3 Talisman slots
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.71.subti: Simba likes to play: Will make snowballs deal 1 damage. For each second the snowball flies, it will deal more damage when it lands
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quests.72.subti: Casper Simulator: Projectiles will pass through your body. It will also slow your attack speed by 50%. You'll need a Belt to wear this Talisman
ftbquests.chapter.resourceful_bees.title: Resourceful Bees
ftbquests.chapter.resourceful_bees.quest: Understanding the bees
Are they buzzing? Left Click for more info

If you're reading this, it means you're about to start working with the bees. In our pack, the bees are split into Lonely Bees and Hive Bees. The Lonely Bees are bees which can be found around the world in different biomes/dimensions (use JEI to see where a Lonely Bee can spawn). The Hive Bees are bees which CANNOT spawn naturally and they're obtained only by breeding Lonely Bees.
The Bees can be used to obtain early farms for certain mob drops and other resources.

To start collecting bees for your farms, you'll need a bee jar made from glass. Additionally, you can just lure the bees to your farm with a lead, or with their respective \"flower\" (each bee can have a different block as its flower and you can use JEI to find out what flower each bee has).
To use your bees properly, you'll need a Hive. Bees can use vanilla hives too, but they won't produce their special combs if a hive from Resourceful Bees is not provided.
Any flower
Centrifuge Mk I
Obtaining more resources. Left Click for more info
When supplied with Honeycombs, Glass Bottles and manual effort, this centrifuge will harvest resources from your honeycombs.
To start using this centrifuge, you have to use Shift Right-Click. Keep in mind that this will work only if the centrifuge is supplied with Combs and Bottles.
Honeycombs
Sweet, yet dangerous. Left Click for more info

Honeycombs will allow you to obtain resources from bees. While the vanilla honeycomb will give you honey, sugar and beeswax, the other honey combs will give you certain resources if you process them right.
Honeycombs can be obtain through various ways:
1. One way is to harvest them from wild bee nests.
2. Another way is through your own hand-made hives which will require some wax and some polished planks.
3. The last, and most efficient way is through Resourceful Bees's hives which will also allow you to obtain special honeycombs.
If you haven't figured it out yet, you'll need to work with naturally generated Bee Nests first, as you'll need Wax in order to start making your own Hives.
Beehive - Tier 0
The Beehive is an early housing option for your bees. Left Click for more info
Beehives are crafted versions of bee nests. Beehives can be mined by any tool or by your fist. This hive can hold a maximum number of 3 bees.
If you harvest the honey from it (with a pair of shears) the bees will emerge out of the hive, angry and they'll try to attack you.
This can be avoided by placing a lit campfire below the Hive or by using a Bee Smoker.
Getting fuzzy. Left Click for more info
The Bee Smoker can be used to stop the bees from getting angry at you, thus allowing for honey and bee collection.
Colection, collection, colllectionnnn! Left Click for more info

The Bee Box can be used to store up to 10 bees at a time. This box can also be used to collect the bees inside a next/hive. To do so, you'll have to smoke the hive/nest first with a Smoker. Shift Right-Click the hive/nest with the box to get the bees.
To release your bees, just Shift Right-Click the box on a random block.
Waxed Planks
Fireproof and beautiful: The Waxed Planks are a nice building block. Additionally, these blocks are fireproof
Capturing them. Left Click for more info
The Bee Jar can be used to capture one Bee. To release it, just Right-Click the jar again.
Placing the jar with a bee in it, in an Anvil and renaming it, will also rename the bee inside the jar.
Keep in mind that having a chest or an inventory with lots of bee filled jars, will cause massive lag.
Beehive - Tier 1
Will hold a maximum amount of 4 bees and 5 honeycombs. It will also allow you to harvest special honeycombs from your bees
Beehive - Tier 2 (2nd Age)
Will hold a maximum amount of 6 bees and 8 honeycombs. It will also reduce the time spent by your bees in the hive by 10%
Beehive - Tier 3 (2nd Age)
Will hold a maximum amount of 8 bees and 10 honeycombs. It will also reduce the time spent by your bees in the hive by 15%
Beehive - Tier 4 (3rd Age)
Will hold a maximum amount of 16 bees and 20 honeycombs. It will also reduce the time spent by your bees in the hive by 20%
Tier 2 Hive Upgrade (2nd Age)
Will get a Tier 1 hive to the 2nd Tier
Tier 3 Hive Upgrade (2nd Age)
Will get a Tier 2 hive to the 3rd Tier
Tier 4 Hive Upgrade (3rd Age)
Will get a Tier 3 hive to the 4th Tier
Honey Congealer (2nd Age)
Freezing without freezing. Left Click for more info
The Congealer can be used to turn liquid honey into its block version.
It does not require RF, however, you'll need some pipes to get the honey into the Congealer.
The \"Șpaclu\": The scraper can be used to harvest honeycombs from the Resourceful Bees Hives. It is unbreakable
Electric Centrifuge (2nd Age)
Electricity everywhere! Left Click for more info

The Centrifuge will use RF to turn your combs into resources. There is a limitation that it can only process honeycombs, not blocks. This process can be automated with Hoppers. Also, keep in mind that this Centrifuge will NOT allow you to process Honeycombs without bottles inside.
Centrifuge Multiblock (2nd Age)
This one has tanks! Left Click for more info
The Multiblock Centrifuge is an upgraded version of the Centrifuge that will increase the amount of resources from the processing of combs and allow processing of comb blocks as well.
This process can be automated with Hoppers/Pipes.
Elite Centrifuge Multiblock (3rd Age)
The Elite Centrifuge is an upgraded version of the Centrifuge Multiblock. It can perform more operations at a time. It can also hold more liquid honey.
Botomless Honey Pot (2nd Age)
The Honey TrashCan: Will void any liquid honey that gets into it
Wooden Honey Tank (2nd Age)
Can hold 8.000 mb (8 buckets) of Liquid Honey
Nether Honey Tank (2nd Age)
Can hold 32.000 mb (32 buckets) of Liquid Honey
Purpur Honey Tank (3rd Age)
Can hold 128.000 mb (128 buckets) of Liquid Buckets
Tier 1 Apiary (3rd Age)
Sounds like honey! Left Click for more info

The Apiary is the next upgrade for the Beehives. It can house more bees, produce more honeycombs and make breeding easier. The Apiary is part of a 7 x 7 x 5 multiblock which contains the main Apiary Block and an Apiary Storage Block and an optional Apiary Breeder and some solid blocks.
Example of the Apiary Structure:

Once placed down the Apiary can then be set up to show a preview of the structure. Blocks must be placed to fill the structure. You can use any blocks with collision or anything marked with the valid_apiary tag. The Apiary Storage and Apiary Breeder can be placed anywhere in the Multiblock's walls.

Keep in mind that the Apiary comes with some restrictions: it can only house 9 unique bees, which means no more than one of the same type of bee in the Apiary at any one time, however you can get past this limitation by keeping bees inside the enclosure.
Tier 2 Apiary (3rd Age)
A slight upgrade to the original Apiary. It will give you a 40% in hive time reduction for your bees. It will also output more honeycombs
Apiary Storage (3rd Age)
